Name: Atta ur Rehman Khan
Content: atta ur rehman khan (urdu: عطا الرحمن خان) computer scientist academician contributed multiple domains field. according stanford university report, among world's top 2% scientists. founder national cyber crime forensics lab pakistan, operates partnership nr3c. published numerous research articles books. senior member ieee acm. == education == khan bright sparks scholar received phd degree computer science university malaya. received master's degree bachelor's degree (with honors) computer science comsats university comsats scholarship. also attended summer camp advance wireless networks technische universität ilmenau daad scholarship. == experience == 2010, khan working associate professor college engineering information technology, ajman university, united arab emirates. experience teaching research different positions served seven universities, namely sohar university, air university, king saud university, comsats university, university malaya qurtuba university. founding director national cyber crime forensics lab pakistan head air university cybersecurity center. also developed pakistan's first bs cybersecurity program approved hec. == editorial boards == atta ur rehman khan editor following journals: associate technical editor, ieee communications magazine. editor, elsevier journal network computer applications. associate editor, ieee access. associate editor, springer journal cluster computing. editor, springerplus. editor, ad hoc & sensor wireless networks. editor, oxford computer journal. editor, ksii transactions internet information systems. associate editor, springer human-centric computing information sciences. == gallery == == honors & awards == atta ur rehman khan received numerous honors awards, as: long-term research achievement award, 2023. world's top 2% scientists, stanford university, usa, 2022. world's top 2% scientists, stanford university, usa, 2020. best paper award, spects, 2018. research productivity Name: Wil van der Aalst
Content: willibrordus martinus pancratius van der aalst (born 29 january 1966) dutch computer scientist full professor rwth aachen university, leading process data science (pads) group. research teaching interests include information systems, workflow management, petri nets, process mining, specification languages, simulation. also known work workflow patterns. == biography education == born eersel, netherlands, van der aalst received msc computing science 1988 technische universiteit eindhoven (tu/e), phd mathematics 1992 thesis "timed colored petri nets application logistics" supervision jaap wessels kees van hee. 1992 started working eindhoven university technology assistant professor department mathematics computing science, headed specification modeling information systems (smis) research group. 2000 2003, part-time full professor computing science department. 2000 2006 head information systems department technology management department tu/e. since 2006 full professor department mathematics & computer science eindhoven university technology. also part-time appointment bpm group queensland university technology (qut). visiting professor karlsruhe institute technology (aifb), university georgia (lsdis), johann wolfgang goethe university frankfurt main (wi-ii), university colorado (ctrg), queensland university technology (citi), aarhus university (daimi), fondazione bruno kessler (fbk). associate editor several journals, including "ieee transactions services computing", "ieee transactions industrial informatics", "international journal business process integration management", "international journal enterprise modelling information systems architectures", "computers industry", "transactions petri nets models concurrency". series editor "lecture notes business information processing" (lnbip) springer, member editorial board "distributed parallel databases" "business information systems engineering", member several steering committees, including "international conference series business process management" (chair), "international conference series application theory petri nets" "international workshop series web services formal methods". also member royal holland society sciences humanities (koninklijke hollandsche maatschappij der wetenschappen) academy europe (academia europaea). van der aalst elected member royal netherlands academy arts sciences 2014. == work == van der aalst's research interest fields information systems, business process management, simulation, petri nets, process models, workflow management systems, verification techniques, process mining, enterprise resource planning systems, computer supported cooperative work, web services, business process redesign, resource allocation interorganizational business processes. strong supporter open-source software. initiated led development of: prom framework, process mining tool yawl, workflow management system several software tools including declare, woflan, xrl, etc. also initiated workflow patterns initiative. work influenced industry standards business process execution language (bpel), business process modeling notation (bpmn), etc. van der aalst's ideas also influenced various widely used commercial software tools flower, protos, futura reflect, staffware, websphere, aris. scientific contributions van der aalst fields business process discovery, event-driven process chains, workflow management coalition xpdl. van der aalst isi highly cited researcher. according google scholar among highest ranked computer scientists world. see h-index computer science. == publications == van der aalst published total 400 books, journal papers, book chapters, conference papers, reports topics. books, selection: van der aalst, wil, kees max van hee. workflow management: models, methods, systems. mit press, 2002; 2004. dumas, marlon, wil m. van der aalst, arthur h. ter hofstede. process-aware information systems: bridging people software process technology. john wiley & sons, 2005. van der aalst, wil. process mining: discovery, conformance enhancement business processes. springer science & business media, 2011. articles, selection: van der aalst, wil mp. "the application petri nets workflow management." journal circuits, systems, computers 8.01 (1998): 21–66. wil van der aalst, arthur h.m. hofstede, bartek kiepuszewski, alistair p. barros (2003). "workflow patterns". in: distributed parallel databases 14 (1): pp. 5–51. doi:10.1023/a:1022883727209. van der aalst, wil mp, arthur hm ter hofstede, mathias weske. "business process management: survey." business process management. springer berlin heidelberg, 2003. 1–12. van der aalst, wil mp, arthur hm ter hofstede. "yawl: yet another workflow language." information systems 30.4 (2005): 245–275. == references == == external links == homepage wil van der aalst eindhoven university technology.

Name: Scott Aaronson
Content: scott joel aaronson (born may 21, 1981) american theoretical computer scientist schlumberger centennial chair computer science university texas austin. primary areas research computational complexity theory quantum computing. == personal life == aaronson married computer scientist dana moshkovitz. aaronson identifies jewish. === early life education === aaronson grew united states, though spent year asia father—a science writer turned public-relations executive—was posted hong kong. enrolled school permitted skip ahead several years math, upon returning us, found education restrictive, getting bad grades run-ins teachers. enrolled clarkson school, gifted education program run clarkson university, enabled aaronson apply colleges freshman year high school. accepted cornell university, obtained bsc computer science 2000, resided telluride house. attended university california, berkeley, phd, got 2004 supervision umesh vazirani. aaronson shown ability mathematics early age, teaching calculus age 11, provoked symbols babysitter's textbook. discovered computer programming age 11, felt lagged behind peers, already coding years. part due aaronson getting advanced mathematics getting computer programming, felt drawn theoretical computing, particularly computational complexity theory. cornell, became interested quantum computing devoted computational complexity quantum computing. == career == postdoctorates institute advanced study university waterloo, took faculty position mit 2007. primary area research quantum computing computational complexity theory generally. summer 2016 moved mit university texas austin david j. bruton jr. centennial professor computer science founding director ut austin's new quantum information center. summer 2022 announced would working year openai theoretical foundations ai safety. === awards === aaronson one two winners 2012 alan t. waterman award. best student paper awards computational complexity conference papers "limitations quantum advice one-way communication" (2004) "quantum certificate complexity" (2003). danny lewin best student paper award symposium theory computing paper "lower bounds local search quantum arguments" (2004). 2009 presidential early career award scientists engineers 2009 sloan research fellowship 2017 simons investigator elected acm fellow 2019 "for contributions quantum computing computational complexity". awarded 2020 acm prize computing "for groundbreaking contributions quantum computing". == popular work == founder complexity zoo wiki, catalogs classes computational complexity. author much-read blog "shtetl-optimized". interview scientific american answers blog called shtetl-optimized, preoccupation past: shtetls jewish villages pre-holocaust eastern europe. they're ancestors came from—some actually place (vitebsk) marc chagall, painted fiddler roof. watched fiddler many times kid, movie play. every time, jolt recognition, like: "so that's world designed inhabit. aspects personality mark weird today, obsessive reading literal-mindedness even rocking back forth—i probably back would've made better talmud scholar, something." also wrote essay "who name bigger number?". latter work, widely distributed academic computer science, uses concept busy beaver numbers described tibor radó illustrate limits computability pedagogic environment. also taught graduate-level survey course, "quantum computing since democritus", notes available online, published book cambridge university press. weaves together disparate topics cohesive whole, including quantum mechanics, complexity, free will, time travel, anthropic principle more. many interdisciplinary applications computational complexity later fleshed article, "why philosophers care computational complexity". since then, aaronson published book entitled quantum computing since democritus based course. article aaronson's, "the limits quantum computers", published scientific american, guest speaker 2007 foundational questions science institute conference. aaronson frequently cited non-academic press, science news, age, zdnet, slashdot, new scientist, new york times, forbes magazine. == alleged love communications plagiarism == aaronson subject media attention october 2007, accused love communications, sydney-based advertising agency, plagiarizing lecture wrote quantum mechanics advertisement theirs. alleged commercial made ricoh australia appropriated content almost verbatim lecture. aaronson received email agency claiming sought legal advice saying believe violation copyright. dissatisfied, aaronson pursued matter, agency settled dispute without admitting wrongdoing making charitable contribution two science organizations choice. concerning matter, aaronson stated, "someone suggested [on blog] cameo models free printer, think i'd take printer." == references == == external links == scott aaronson mathematics genealogy project aaronson's website aaronson's blog

Name: Rediet Abebe
Content: rediet abebe (amharic: ረድኤት አበበ) ethiopian computer scientist working algorithms artificial intelligence. assistant professor computer science university california, berkeley. previously, junior fellow harvard society fellows. abebe's research develops mathematical computational frameworks examining questions related inequality distributive justice. co-founded multi-institutional interdisciplinary research initiatives mechanism design social good (md4sg) black ai. == early life education == abebe born raised addis ababa, ethiopia. educated ethiopian national curriculum nazareth school winning competitive merit-based scholarship attend international community school addis ababa high school. abebe attended harvard university earned bachelor arts degree mathematics later master science degree applied mathematics. undergraduate, co-authored research papers mathematics, physics, public health. harvard, abebe contributed harvard crimson staff writer, focused cambridge public school system (2009-2011). college, attended university cambridge governor william shirley scholar pembroke college. completed part iii mathematics tripos earned master advanced studies pure mathematics supervision imre leader. abebe completed doctoral degree computer science cornell university, advised jon kleinberg. dissertation made notable contributions across multiple fields computer science, receiving 2020 acm sigkdd dissertation award honorable mention acm sigecom dissertation award. first black woman complete ph.d. computer science university's history. == research career == abebe's research develops techniques ai algorithms, focus inequality distributive justice. work includes algorithmic frameworks examining issues underserved populations. abebe's interest merging inequality studies computer science stemmed educational background ethiopia well study cambridge public schools attendance school board meetings. experiences emphasizes potential social harms inequitable algorithmic design work. throughout 2019 abebe served national institutes health working group ai along ai experts including kate crawford, dina katabi, daphne koller, eric lander. working group tasked developing comprehensive report recommendations, unanimously approved advisory committee director nih general director francis collins. 2019, abebe inducted harvard society fellows. second junior fellow cs ph.d., first female computer scientist, first black computer scientist society's history. abebe joined department electrical engineering computer sciences university california, berkeley assistant professor, focused research areas artificial intelligence; information, data, network, communication sciences; theory. first black female professor history department second history college engineering. abebe member berkeley artificial intelligence research lab (bair); berkeley institute data science (bids); center information technology research interest society - banatao institute (citris); center theoretical foundations learning, inference, information, intelligence, mathematics, microeconomics berkeley (climb). abebe also leads berkeley equity access algorithms, mechanisms, optimization research group (beaamo). === mechanism design social good === abebe co-founded mechanism design social good (md4sg), multi-disciplinary research collective uses algorithms mechanism design tackle inequality, kira goldner 2016, alongside multi-institutional reading group 12 members. abebe since co-organizing initiative irene lo ana-andrea stoica. md4sg hosts annual workshop series highlighting work connecting community researchers committed using algorithms improve societal welfare. 2021, co-launched acm conference equity access algorithms, mechanisms, optimization (eaamo) served inaugural program co-chair. abebe honored pioneer 2019 mit technology review's innovators 35 part work co-founding md4sg. dissertation received 2020 acm sigkdd dissertation award honorable mention acm sigecom dissertation award offering foundations emerging research area. === black ai === abebe co-founded black ai, network 1,500 researchers working ai, timnit gebru, 2016. organization arranges annual workshops conference neural information processing systems (neurips) offers networking collaborative opportunities. black ai, abebe spearheaded academic program, honored 2019 bloomberg 50 list one watch. == awards honors == 2018: bloomberg 50, one watch. 2018: harvard-cambridge fellowship, harvard. 2019: harvard society fellows, junior fellow. 2019: mit technology review, 35 35. 2020: acm sigkdd dissertation award. 2020: acm sigecom dissertation award (honorable mention). 2020: innovation equity, rising star award. 2020: 100 influential young africans, african youth awards. 2022: class andrew carnegie fellows. == references == == external links == rediet abebe publications indexed google scholar uses algorithms ai fight socioeconomic inequality mit technology review 'pioneers, breaking old ways, create better ai, antibiotics, even architecture'.

Name: Hal Abelson
Content: harold abelson (born april 26, 1947) american mathematician computer scientist. professor computer science engineering department electrical engineering computer science massachusetts institute technology (mit), founding director creative commons free software foundation, creator mit app inventor platform, co-author widely-used textbook structure interpretation computer programs, sometimes also referred "the wizard book." directed first implementation language logo apple ii, made language widely available personal computers starting 1981; published widely selling book logo 1982. together gerald jay sussman, abelson developed mit's introductory computer science subject, structure interpretation computer programs (called course number, 6.001), subject organized around idea computer language primarily formal medium expressing ideas methodology, rather way get computer perform operations. abelson sussman also cooperate codirecting mit project mathematics computation. mit opencourseware (ocw) project spearheaded abelson mit faculty. abelson led internal investigation mit's choices role prosecution aaron swartz federal bureau investigation (fbi), concluded mit nothing wrong legally, recommended mit consider changing internal policies. == education == abelson graduated bachelor arts degree mathematics princeton university 1969 completing senior thesis actions fixed-point set: homology sphere, supervised william browder. received phd mathematics massachusetts institute technology 1973 completing research topologically distinct conjugate varieties finite fundamental group supervised dennis sullivan. == career research == abelson also founding director creative commons public knowledge, director center democracy technology. === computer science education === abelson longstanding interest using computation conceptual framework teaching. directed first implementation logo apple ii, made language widely available personal computers starting 1981; published widely selling book logo 1982. book turtle geometry, written andrea disessa 1981, presented computational approach geometry cited "the first step revolutionary change entire teaching/learning process." march 2015, copy abelson's 1969 implementation turtle graphics sold algorithm auction, world’s first auction computer algorithms. together gerald jay sussman, abelson developed mit's introductory computer science subject, structure interpretation computer programs, subject organized around notion computer language primarily formal medium expressing ideas methodology, rather way get computer perform operations. work, textbook name, videotapes lectures, availability personal computers scheme dialect lisp (used teaching course), worldwide impact university computer science education. visiting faculty member google, part app inventor android team, educational program aiming make easy people programming background write mobile phone applications "explore whether could change nature introductory computing". coauthor book app inventor david wolber, ellen spertus, liz looney, published o'reilly media 2011. google released app inventor open source software late 2009 provided seed funding mit media lab 2011, abelson became codirector mit center mobile learning continue development app inventor. === computing tools === abelson sussman also cooperate codirecting mit project mathematics computation, project mit computer science artificial intelligence laboratory (csail), formerly joint project mit artificial intelligence laboratory (ai lab) mit laboratory computer science (lcs), csail's components. goal project create better computational tools scientists engineers. even powerful numerical computers, exploring complex physical systems still requires substantial human effort human judgement prepare simulations interpret numerical results. together students, abelson sussman combining methods numerical computation, symbolic algebra, heuristic programming develop programs perform massive numerical computations, also interpret computations discuss results qualitative terms. programs could form basis intelligent scientific instruments monitor physical systems based upon high-level behavioral descriptions. generally, could lead new generation computational tools autonomously explore complex physical systems, play important part future practice science engineering. time, programs incorporate computational formulations scientific knowledge form foundations better ways teach science engineering. === free software movement === abelson sussman also part free software movement (fsm), including serving board directors free software foundation (fsf). abelson known involved publishing andrew huang's hacking xbox keith winstein's seven-line perl decss script (named qrpff), library access music project (lamp), mit's campus-wide music distribution system. mit opencourseware (ocw) project spearheaded hal abelson mit faculty. === aaron swartz investigation === january 2013, open access activist aaron swartz died suicide. arrested near mit facing 35 years imprisonment alleged crime downloading journal storage (jstor) articles mit's open access campus network. response, mit appointed professor hal abelson lead internal investigation school's choices role prosecution aaron swartz fbi. report delivered july 26, 2013. concluded mit nothing wrong legally, recommended mit consider changing internal policies. === awards honors === designated one mit's six inaugural macvicar faculty fellows, 1992, recognition significant sustained contributions teaching undergraduate education 1992 bose award, mit school engineering teaching award 1995 taylor l. booth education award, given ieee computer society, cited continued contributions pedagogy teaching introductory computer science 2011 acm karl v. karlstrom outstanding educator award "his contribution computing education, innovative advances curricula designed students pursuing different kinds computing expertise, leadership movement open educational resources" 2012 association computing machinery (acm) sigcse award outstanding contribution computer science education === publications === structure interpretation computer programs turtle geometry: computer medium exploring mathematics blown bits: life, liberty, happiness digital explosion app inventor 2: create android apps == references ==

Name: Serge Abiteboul
Content: serge joseph abiteboul (born 25 august 1953 paris, france) french computer scientist working areas data management, database theory, finite model theory. == education == son two hardware store owners, abiteboul attended high-school romorantin, higher school preparatory classes tours. admitted télécom paris engineering school studied technion haifa year. abiteboul received phd university southern california supervision seymour ginsburg, 1982. == career research == abiteboul senior researcher institut national de recherche en informatique et en automatique (inria), french national research institute focussing computer science related areas, professor collège de france. known many contributions areas finite model theory, database theory, database systems. finite model theory, abiteboul–vianu theorem states polynomial time equal pspace fixed point logic partial fixed point logic. database theory, contributed wide variety results, recent languages distributed processing xml data. data management, best known early work semistructured web databases. 2008, according citeseer, highly cited researcher data management area works european institution. abiteboul also known two books, one database theory one web data management. frequently writes french newspapers, including le monde, libération la tribune member arcep, independent agency charge regulating telecommunications france, abiteboul advocate net neutrality. also critical virtual assistants impact privacy. 2019, among members group tasked french government addressing online bullying harassment. == awards honours == abiteboul awarded association computing machinery (acm) sigmod test time award 2004, prix eads 2007 acm pods alberto o. mendelzon test-of-time award (2008). abiteboul elected member french academy sciences 2008, european academy sciences 2011, acm fellow 2011. == references ==

Name: Samson Abramsky
Content: samson abramsky (born 12 march 1953) professor computer science university college london. previously christopher strachey professor computing wolfson college, oxford, 2000 2021. abramsky's early work included profound contributions domain theory connections thereof geometric logic. since then, work covered lazy lambda calculus, strictness analysis, concurrency theory, interaction categories geometry interaction, game semantics quantum computing. notably, co-pioneered categorical quantum mechanics. recently, applying methods categorical semantics finite model theory, applications descriptive complexity. == education == abramsky educated hasmonean grammar school boys, hendon king's college, cambridge (ba 1975, philosophy 1979, diploma computer science) queen mary, university london (phd computer science 1988, supervised richard bornat). == career research == since 2021, abramsky professor computer science university college london. fellow royal society since 2004. research includes development game semantics, domain theory logical form, categorical quantum mechanics. earlier positions include: programmer, gec computers limited, 1976–1978 lecturer, department computer science statistics, qmul, 1980–1983 lecturer, 1983–1988, reader, 1988–1990, professor, 1990–1995, department computing, imperial college london professor theoretical computer science, university edinburgh, 1996–2000 christopher strachey professor computing, university oxford, 2000–2021 abramsky played leading role development game semantics, applications semantics programming languages. notable contributions include work domain theory logical form, lazy lambda calculus, strictness analysis, concurrency theory, interaction categories, geometry interaction. recently working high-level methods quantum computation information. === selected publications === samson abramsky co-edited 6 volumes handbook logic computer science dov gabbay tom maibaum: 1992. volume 1: background: mathematical structures. 1992. volume 2: background: computational structures. 1995. volume 3: semantic structures. 1995. volume 4: semantic modelling. 2001. volume 5: logic algebraic methods. volume 6: logical methods computer science. abramsky published two hundred publications h-index 57 october 2019. 1986. strictness analysis higher-order functions. (with gl burn, c hankin). science computer programming. 1990. lazy lambda calculus. research topics functional programming. 1993. computational interpretations linear logic. theoretical computer science 111 1994. domain theory. (with jung). handbook logic computer science 3. 1996. interaction categories foundations typed concurrent programming. (with gay r nagarajan). nato asi series f computer systems sciences 152 1997. specifying interaction categories. (with pavlović). category theory computer science 2002. geometry interaction linear combinatory algebras. (with e haghverdi p scott). mathematical structures computer science 12 (5) 2003. sequentiality vs. concurrency games logic. mathematical structures computer science 13 (4) later works abramsky include: 2010. introduction categories categorical logic. (with n. tzevelekos). new structures physics. springer. 2012. logical bell inequalities. (with lucien hardy). physical review a. vol. 85. no. artn 062114. 2013. robust constraint satisfaction local hidden variables quantum mechanics. (with g. gottlob p. kolaitis). ijcai. == awards honours == abramsky fellow royal society (2004), fellow royal society edinburgh (2000), member academia europaea (1993). member editorial boards north holland studies logic foundations mathematics, cambridge tracts theoretical computer science. general chair lics 2000–2003, member lics organizing committee. elected fellow acm (2014) contributions domains logical form, game semantics, categorical quantum mechanics, contextual semantics. awarded bcs lovelace medal 2013 paper "domain theory logical form" lics test-of-time award (a 20-year retrospective) 1987. award presented lics 2007. awarded epsrc senior research fellowship foundational structures methods quantum informatics 2007. fellow royal society (2004) fellow royal society edinburgh (2000) abramsky's nomination royal society reads: samson abramsky distinguished seminal contributions mathematical foundations computation. outstanding achievement development game semantics theory computational processes exposes mathematical structure information flow them. led powerful applications study programming languages, offering decisive new insights nature sequentiality, state, control, many computational features. leading turn new developments computer-assisted program analysis verification. important strand, also stands contribution logic, generalisation girard's geometry interaction, leading new genre full completeness theorems, characterise 'space proofs' logic. previously, abramsky made important contributions abstract interpretation, domain theory, lambda calculus concurrency. continues shed light broad range topics sharp creative insights, breaking new ground, bringing order unity existing work. == references ==

Name: Leonard Adleman

b.a. degree mathematics 1968 ph.d. degree eecs 1976. also mathematical consultant movie sneakers. 1996, became member national academy engineering contributions theory computation cryptography. also member national academy sciences. adleman also amateur boxer sparred james toney. == discovery == 1994, paper molecular computation solutions combinatorial problems described experimental use dna computational system. it, solved seven-node instance hamiltonian graph problem, np-complete problem similar travelling salesman problem. solution seven-node instance trivial, paper first known instance successful use dna compute algorithm. dna computing shown potential means solve several large-scale combinatorial search problems. adleman widely referred father dna computing. 2002, research group managed solve 'nontrivial' problem using dna computation. specifically, solved 20-variable sat problem 1 million potential solutions. manner similar one adleman used seminal 1994 paper. first, mixture dna strands logically representative problem's solution space synthesized. mixture operated upon algorithmically using biochemical techniques winnow 'incorrect' strands, leaving behind strands 'satisfied' problem. analysis nucleotide sequence remaining strands revealed 'correct' solutions original problem. one original discoverers adleman–pomerance–rumely primality test. fred cohen, 1984 paper, experiments computer viruses credited adleman coining term "computer virus". 2017, adleman working mathematical theory strata. computer science professor university southern california. == awards == contribution invention rsa cryptosystem, adleman, along ron rivest adi shamir, recipient 1996 paris kanellakis theory practice award 2002 turing award, often called nobel prize computer Name: Manindra Agrawal
Content: manindra agrawal (born 20 may 1966) indian computer scientist professor department computer science engineering indian institute technology, kanpur. recipient first infosys prize mathematics, godel prize 2006; shanti swarup bhatnagar award mathematical sciences 2003. honoured padma shri, india's 4th highest civilian award, 2013. == career == created aks primality test neeraj kayal nitin saxena, co-authors 2006 fulkerson prize, 2006 gödel prize. also awarded 2002 clay research award work. test first unconditional deterministic algorithm test n-digit number primality time proven polynomial n. september 2008, agrawal chosen first infosys mathematics prize outstanding contributions broad field mathematics. also served mathematical sciences jury infosys prize 2014 2015. visiting scholar institute advanced study 2003-04. agarwal served deputy director iit kanpur 2017 2021. on, 19 april 2024 appointed director iit kanpur. == awards honors == clay research award (2002) bhatnagar prize mathematical sciences (2003) ictp prize (2003) fulkerson prize (2006) gödel prize (2006) infosys prize (2008) g.d. birla award scientific research (2009) twas prize mathematics (2010) padma shri (2013) goyal prize (2017) == references == == external links == homepage blog report manindra agrawal mathematics genealogy project

side effect. famous example esp game, online game two randomly paired people simultaneously shown picture, way communicate. lists number words phrases describe picture within time limit, rewarded image search. von ahn's games brought coverage mainstream media. thesis best doctoral dissertation award carnegie mellon university's school computer science. july 2006, von ahn gave tech talk google Name: Alfred Aho
Content: alfred vaino aho (born august 9, 1941) canadian computer scientist best known work programming languages, compilers, related algorithms, textbooks art science computer programming. aho elected national academy engineering 1999 contributions fields algorithms programming tools. long-time collaborator jeffrey ullman recipients 2020 turing award, generally recognized highest distinction computer science. == career == aho received b.a.sc. (1963) engineering physics university toronto, m.a. (1965) ph.d. (1967) electrical engineering/computer science princeton university. conducted research bell labs 1967 1991, 1997 2002 vice president computing sciences research center. since 1995, held lawrence gussman professorship computer science columbia university. served chair department 1995 1997, spring 2003. phd thesis aho created indexed grammars nested-stack automaton vehicles extending power context-free languages, retaining many decidability closure properties. one application indexed grammars modelling parallel rewriting systems, particularly biological applications. graduating princeton, aho joined computing sciences research center bell labs devised efficient regular expression string-pattern matching algorithms implemented first versions unix tools egrep fgrep. fgrep algorithm become known aho–corasick algorithm; used several bibliographic search-systems, including one developed margaret j. corasick, string-searching applications. bell labs, aho worked closely steve johnson jeffrey ullman develop efficient algorithms analyzing translating programming languages. steve johnson used bottom-up lalr parsing algorithms create syntax-analyzer generator yacc, michael e. lesk eric schmidt used aho's regular-expression pattern-matching algorithms create lexical-analyzer generator lex. lex yacc tools derivatives used develop front ends many today's programming language compilers. aho ullman wrote series textbooks compiling techniques codified theory relevant compiler design. 1977 textbook principles compiler design green dragon front cover became known "the green dragon book". 1986 aho ullman joined ravi sethi create new edition, "the red dragon book" (which briefly shown 1995 movie hackers), 2006 also monica lam create "the purple dragon book". dragon books used university courses well industry references. 1974, aho, john hopcroft, ullman wrote design analysis computer algorithms, codifying early research algorithms. book became one highly cited books computer science several decades helped stimulate creation algorithms data structures central course computer science curriculum. aho also widely known co-authorship awk programming language peter j. weinberger brian kernighan (the "a" stands "aho"). 2010 aho's research interests include programming languages, compilers, algorithms, quantum computing. part language compilers research-group columbia university. overall, works cited 81,040 times h-index 66, may 8, 2019. aho received many prestigious honors, including ieee's john von neumann medal membership national academy engineering. elected fellow american academy arts sciences 2003. holds honorary doctorates university waterloo, university helsinki, university toronto. fellow american association advancement science, acm, bell labs, ieee. aho twice served chair advisory committee computer information science engineering directorate national science foundation. past president acm special interest group algorithms computability theory. aho, hopcroft, ullman co-recipients 2017 c&c prize awarded nec corporation. ullman named recipients 2020 turing award march 31, 2021. == teaching == aho taught columbia university new york city since 1995. great teacher award society columbia graduates 2003. == books == a. v. aho j. d. ullman, theory parsing, translation, compiling, vol. 1, parsing. Name: Gene Amdahl
Content: gene myron amdahl (november 16, 1922 – november 10, 2015) american computer architect high-tech entrepreneur, chiefly known work mainframe computers ibm later companies, especially amdahl corporation. formulated amdahl's law, states fundamental limitation parallel computing. == childhood education == amdahl born immigrant parents norwegian swedish descent flandreau, south dakota. serving navy world war ii completed degree engineering physics south dakota state university 1948. went study theoretical physics university wisconsin–madison robert g. sachs. however, 1950, amdahl charles h. "charlie" davidson, fellow phd student department physics, approached harold a. peterson idea digital computer. amdahl davidson gained support peterson fellow electrical engineering professor vincent c. rideout, encouraged build computer unique design. amdahl completed doctorate uw–madison 1952 thesis titled logical design intermediate speed digital computer created first computer, wisconsin integrally synchronized computer (wisc). went straight wisconsin position ibm june 1952. == ibm == ibm, amdahl worked ibm 704, ibm 709, stretch project, basis ibm 7030. left ibm december 1955, returned september 1960 (after working ramo-wooldridge aeronutronic). quit frustration bureaucratic structure organization. interview conducted 1989 charles babbage institute, addressed this: well, felt kind organization i'm going control want time future. going much bureaucratic structure. i'll work one area it, that's i'll get experience in. decided want kind life, basically. dunwell. way structure set up; going peg-in-a-hole. return, became chief architect ibm system/360 named ibm fellow 1965, head advanced computing systems laboratory (acs) menlo park, california. == amdahl corporation == left ibm september 1970, ideas computer development rejected, set amdahl corporation sunnyvale, california major financing fujitsu. competing ibm mainframe market, company manufactured "plug-compatible" mainframes, shipping first machine 1975 – amdahl 470v/6, less expensive, reliable faster replacement system 370/168. purchasing amdahl 470 plug-compatible peripheral devices third-party manufacturers, customers could run s/360 s/370 applications without buying actual ibm hardware. amdahl's software team developed vm/pe (virtual machine/performance enhancement), software designed optimize performance ibm's mvs operating system running ibm's vm operating system. 1979, amdahl corporation sold us$1 billion v6 v7 mainframes 6,000 employees worldwide. corporation went distribute ibm-plug-compatible front-end processor (the 4705) well high-performance disk drives, jointly developed fujitsu engineers. 1967 spring joint computer conference, amdahl, along three computer architects, notably illiac iv architect daniel slotnick, engaged discussion future architectural trends. amdahl articulated arguments, verbally three written pages, fundamental physical limitations theorized would govern performance special feature mode introduced new machines. set arguments resulted two, major lesser, "laws" computer performance regarding sequential versus parallel processing. arguments continue day. == 1979–2015: entrepreneur == amdahl left eponymous company august 1979 set trilogy systems, together son carl, clifford madden. us$200 million funds, trilogy aimed designing wafer-scale microprocessor even cheaper mainframes, chip development failed within months company's $60 million public offering; thereafter, company focused developing vlsi technology and, project failed, 1985, trilogy merged elxsi, computer maker cpu design. elxsi also poorly amdahl left 1989, already founded next venture, andor international, 1987. andor hoped compete mid-sized mainframe market, using improved manufacturing techniques developed one company's employees, robert f. brown, make smaller, efficient machines. production problems strong competition led company bankruptcy 1995. amdahl co-founded commercial data servers 1996, sunnyvale, developing mainframe-like machines time new super-cooled processor designs aimed physically smaller systems. one machine, 1997, esp/490 (enterprise server platform/490), enhancement ibm's p/390 system/390 family. since then, cds changed name narrowed focus. xbridge systems, company builds software scan mainframe datasets database tables sensitive information credit card numbers, social security government identification numbers, sensitive medical diagnosis information linked individual, information needed electronic discovery. november 2004, amdahl appointed board advisors massively parallel technologies. died november 10, 2015, palo alto, california, pneumonia, six days shy 93rd birthday. also alzheimer's disease last years life. == awards recognition == amdahl named ibm fellow 1965, became member national academy engineering 1967 recognized centennial alumnus south dakota state university 1986. numerous awards patents credit received honorary doctorates two alma maters two institutions well. amdahl elected distinguished fellow british computer society (dfbcs) 1979, 1983 awarded harry h. goode memorial award ieee computer society "in recognition outstanding contributions design, applications manufacture large-scale high-performance computers." 1998, made fellow computer history museum "for fundamental work computer architecture design, project management, leadership." november 2007, amdahl recognized sigda pioneering achievement award. banquet dinner honor featured short talk amdahl career, panel debate future parallel processing. panelists included john gustafson (known gustafson's law). talk debate videotaped, available sigda web page, acm digital library. == see also == amdahl's law amdahl corporation ibm mainframe fud – term coined amdahl describe ibm's competitive tactics == references == == external links == oral history interview gene m. amdahl charles babbage institute, university minnesota. amdahl discusses graduate work university wisconsin design wisc. discusses role designing several computers ibm including ibm 7030 stretch, ibm 701, ibm 704. discusses work nathaniel rochester ibm's management design process. mentions work ramo-wooldridge, aeronutronic, computer sciences corporation

Name: David P. Anderson
Content: david pope anderson (born 1955) american research scientist space sciences laboratory, university california, berkeley, adjunct professor computer science university houston. anderson leads seti@home, boinc, bossa, bolt software projects. == education == anderson received ba mathematics wesleyan university, ms phd degrees mathematics computer science university wisconsin–madison. graduate school published four research papers computer graphics. phd research involved using enhanced attribute grammars specify implement communication protocols. == career == 1985 1992 assistant professor uc berkeley computer science department, received nsf presidential young investigator ibm faculty development awards. period conducted several research projects: formula (forth music language), parallel programming language runtime system computer music based forth. mood (musical object-oriented dialect), parallel programming language runtime system computer music based c++. port ms-dos also exists. dash, distributed operating system support digital audio video. continuous media file system (cmfs), file system digital audio video comet, i/o server digital audio video. 1992 1994 worked sonic solutions, developed sonic system, first distributed system professional digital audio editing. === inventions === 1994 invented "virtual reality television", television system allowing viewers control virtual position orientation. awarded patent invention 1996. 1994 developed one first systems collaborative filtering, developed web site, rare.com, provided movie recommendations based user's movie ratings. 1995 1998 chief technical officer tunes.com, developed web-based systems music discovery based collaborative filtering, acoustics, models. 1995 joined david gedye dan werthimer creating seti@home, early volunteer computing project. anderson continues direct seti@home. 2000 2002, served cto united devices, company developed software distributed computing. === berkeley open infrastructure network computing === 2002 created berkeley open infrastructure network computing project, develops open-source software platform volunteer computing. project funded nsf based uc berkeley space sciences laboratory. boinc used 100 projects, including seti@home, einstein@home, rosetta@home, climateprediction.net, ibm world community grid. used platform several distributed applications areas diverse mathematics, medicine, molecular biology, climatology, astrophysics. anderson involved stardust@home, used 23,000 volunteers identify interstellar dust particles via web – approach called distributed thinking. 2007 anderson launched two new software projects: bossa (middleware distributed thinking), bolt (a framework web-based training education context volunteer computing distributed thinking). === berkeley open system skill aggregation === berkeley open system skill aggregation (bossa) software framework distributed thinking, using volunteers internet perform tasks require human intelligence, knowledge, cognitive skills. == references == == external links == profile david anderson

Name: Andrew Appel
Content: andrew wilson appel (born 1960) eugene higgins professor computer science princeton university. especially well-known compiler books, modern compiler implementation ml (isbn 0-521-58274-1) series, well compiling continuations (isbn 0-521-41695-7). also major contributor standard ml new jersey compiler, along david macqueen, john h. reppy, matthias blume others one authors rog-o-matic. == biography == andrew appel son mathematician kenneth appel, proved four-color theorem 1976. appel graduated summa cum laude a.b. physics princeton university 1981 completing senior thesis, titled "investigation galaxy clustering using asymptotically fast n-body algorithm", supervision nobel laureate james peebles. later received ph.d. (computer science) carnegie mellon university, 1985. became acm fellow 1998, due research programming languages compilers. 1981, appel developed better approach n-body problem linearithmic instead quadratic time. july 2005 july 2006, visiting researcher institut national de recherche en informatique et en automatique (inria), rocquencourt, france, sabbatical princeton university. andrew appel campaigns issues related interaction law computer technology. testified penalty phase microsoft antitrust case 2002. opposed introduction computerized voting machines, deemed untrustworthy. 2007, received attention purchased number voting machines purpose investigating security. 2024, testified expert voting machines federal court hearings led preliminary injunction disallowing new jersey’s “county line” system alleged provide unfair advantage candidates backed county political party organizations. == references == == external links == website princeton

Name: Bruce Arden
Content: bruce wesley arden ((1927-05-29)may 29, 1927 – (2021-12-08)december 8, 2021) american computer scientist. arden enlisted u.s. navy world war ii (1944-1946) radar technician third class california, chicago, kodiak, alaska. graduated purdue university bs(ee) 1949 started computing career 1950 wiring programming ibm's hybrid (mechanical electronic) card programmed computer/calculator allison division general motors. next spent short period programmer computations done university michigan's willow run laboratory using standards eastern automatic computer. became research associate university michigan's statistical research laboratory later associate director university's computing center establishment 1959. michigan co-authored two compilers, gat ibm 650 mad ibm 704/709/7090, involved design architecture negotiations ibm virtual memory features would included became ibm system/360 model 67 computer, initial design michigan terminal system (mts) time-sharing operating system.: 12 u-m vice president research geoffrey norman, writing 1976, gave special credit triumvirate michigan computer specialists contributed greatly future computing michigan nation whole. "bartels, arden, westervelt," norman said, "were team took great care broken induced leave university. westervelt, hardware expert, arden, brilliant software logic, bartels orchestrating progress-these three put together superb timesharing computer system. university faculty colleagues owe much." arden's increasing interest academic computer science engineering motivated complete doctoral program electrical engineering 1965. subsequently professor in, ultimately chairman of, computer communication sciences department michigan.: 16 1973 accepted professorship princeton university chaired department electrical engineering computer science. 1986, princeton's alexander doty professor engineering, went university rochester dean college engineering applied science. three years preceding addition "emeritus" academic title (william may professor engineering) 1995, also served rochester's vice provost telecommunications computing. academic career, arden wrote two books numerical computation edited another computer science engineering research. wrote many papers areas compilers, operating systems, computer logic networks. addition, supervised many students, undergraduate graduate, studies various aspects computing, served consultant government agencies several major computer companies various times years. retired 1995 lived michigan maine. == references == == external links == "bruce arden named william f. may professor engineering", tom rickey, university rochester, november 23, 1992. video (46 minutes), bruce w. arden collection (afc/2001/001/97393), veterans history project, american folklife center, library congress. Name: Kevin Ashton
Content: kevin ashton (born 1968) british technology pioneer cofounded auto-id center massachusetts institute technology (mit), created global standard system rfid sensors. known coining term "the internet things" describe system internet connected physical world via ubiquitous sensors. == biography == ashton born birmingham, uk. read scandinavian studies university college london 1990 1994. working assistant brand manager procter & gamble (p&g) 1997 became interested using rfid help manage p&g's supply chain. work led mit, helped start rfid research consortium called auto-id center professors sanjay sarma sunny siu researcher david brock. center opened 1999 industry-sponsored research project goal creating global open standard system put rfid everywhere. ashton center's executive director. siu, sarma, acted research director, later chairman research. ashton sarma's leadership, number sponsors grew 103, additional labs funded major universities around world. system developed, mit licensed not-for-profit standards body gs1 project reached successful conclusion. labs renamed auto-id labs continue research. ashton became high-tech entrepreneur start-ups thingmagic, cleantech company enernoc (nasdaq:enoc) zensi, energy-sensing company founded shwetak patel among others. zensi acquired belkin international april 2010. ashton developed launched belkin wemo (originally stylized wemo) home automation system. writes rfid journal, medium quartz, published book, fly horse random house 2015. january 2016, fly horse "best business book" 1-800-ceo-read. april 2013 quartz article ashton created santiago swallow, fictional mexican social media guru specializes "imagined self", fictional expert furnished 90,000 paid-for twitter followers wikipedia biography. creation swallow attempt show credibility unrelated quantity twitter followers. == scientific publications == kevin ashton's scientific publications found leading science media journals: atlantic; Content: sanjeev arora (born january 1968) indian american theoretical computer scientist works ai machine learning. == life == sanjeev scored iit jee number 1 rank 1986 visiting scholar institute advanced study 2002–03. 2008 inducted fellow association computing machinery. 2011 awarded acm infosys foundation award (now renamed acm prize computing), given mid-career researchers computer science. two time recipient gödel prize (2001 & 2010). arora awarded fulkerson prize 2012 work improving approximation ratio graph separators related problems ( log ⁡ n ) {\displaystyle o(\log n)} ( log ⁡ n ) {\displaystyle o({\sqrt {\log n}})} (jointly satish rao umesh vazirani). 2012 became simons investigator. arora elected 2015 american academy arts sciences 2018 national academy sciences. plenary speaker 2018 international congress mathematicians. coauthor (with boaz barak) book computational complexity: modern approach. founder princeton's center computational intractability. coauthors argued certain financial products associated computational asymmetry, certain conditions may lead market instability. since september 2023, founding director princeton language intelligence, new unit princeton university devoted study large ai models applications. == books == arora, sanjeev; barak, boaz (2009). computational complexity: modern approach. cambridge university press. isbn 978-0-521-42426-4. oclc 286431654. == references == == external links == sanjeev arora's homepage sanjeev arora mathematics genealogy project

inventor electronic digital computer. == postwar life == following world war ii atanasoff remained government developed specialized seismographs microbarographs long-range explosive detection. 1952 Name: Charles Bachman
Content: charles william bachman iii (december 11, 1924 – july 13, 2017) american computer scientist, spent entire career industrial researcher, developer, manager rather academia. particularly known work early development database management systems. techniques layered architecture include namesake bachman diagrams. == biography == charles bachman born manhattan, kansas, 1924, father, charles bachman jr., head football coach kansas state college. attended high school east lansing, michigan, father served head football coach michigan state college 1933–1946. world war ii joined united states army spent march 1944 february 1946 south west pacific theater serving anti-aircraft artillery corps new guinea, australia, philippine islands. first exposed used fire control computers aiming 90 mm guns. discharge 1946 attended michigan state college graduated 1948 bachelor's degree mechanical engineering, member tau beta pi. mid-1949 married connie hadley. attended university pennsylvania. 1950, graduated master's degree mechanical engineering, also completed three-quarters requirements mba university's wharton school business. bachman died july 13, 2017, home lexington, massachusetts, parkinson's disease age 92. == work == bachman spent entire career practicing software engineer manager industry rather academia. 1950 started working dow chemical midland, michigan. 1957 became dow's first data processing manager. worked ibm user group share developing new version report generator software, became known 9pac. however, planned ibm 709 order cancelled arrived. 1960 joined general electric, 1963 developed integrated data store (ids), one first database management systems using came known navigational database model, manufacturing information control system (miacs) product. working customer weyerhaeuser lumber, developed first multiprogramming network access ids database, early online transaction processing system called weycos 1965. later ge developed "databasic" product offered database support basic language timesharing users. 1970, ge sold computer business honeywell information systems, family moved phoenix, arizona lexington, massachusetts. 1981, joined smaller firm, cullinane information systems (later cullinet), offered version ids called idms supported ibm mainframes. === bachman information systems === 1983, founded bachman information systems, developed line computer-aided software engineering (case) products. centerpiece products bachman/data analyst, provided graphic support creation maintenance bachman diagrams. featured ibm's reengineering cycle marketing program, combining: reverse engineering obsolete mainframe databases, data modeling, forward engineering new physical databases, optimization physical database designs performance dbms specifics. 1991 bachman information systems initial public offering, trading nasdaq symbol bach. reaching high $37.75 february 1992, price hit $1.75 1995. 1996, company merged cadre technology form cayenne software. served president combined company year, retired tucson, arizona. continued serve chairman board cayenne, acquired sterling software 1998. == awards == bachman received turing award association computing machinery (acm) 1973 "his outstanding contributions database technology". elected distinguished fellow british computer society 1977 pioneering work database systems. 2012, bachman awarded national medal technology innovation "for fundamental inventions database management, transaction processing, software engineering." named acm fellow 2014 “for contributions database technology, notably integrated data store”. 2015, made fellow computer history museum early work developing database systems. == publications == bachman published dozens publications papers. selection: 1962. "precedence diagrams: key production planning, scheduling control." in: proco features. supplement 24, august 24. . 1965. "integrated data store." in: dpma quarterly, january 1965. 1969. "software random access processing." in: datamation april 1965. 1969. "data structure diagrams." in: database: quarterly newsletter sigbdp. vol. 1, no. 2, summer 1969. 1972. "architecture definition technique: objectives, theory, process, facilities, practice." co-authored j. bouvard. in: data description, access control: proceedings 1972 acm-sigfidet workshop, november 29-december 1, 1972. 1972. "the evolution storage structures." in: communications acm vol. 15, no. 7, july 1972. 1972-73. "set concept data structure." in: encyclopedia computer science, 1972–1973. 1973. "the programmer navigator." 1973 acm turing award lecture. in: communications acm vol. 16, no. 11, november 1973. (pdf) 1974. "implementation techniques data structure sets." in: data base management systems, 1974. 1977. "why restrict modeling capability codasyl data structure sets?" in: national computer conference vol. 46, 1977. 1978. "commentary codasyl systems committee's interim report distributed database technology." national computer conference vol. 47, 1978. 1978. "ddp infinitely affected, managers beware!" in: dm, march 1978. 1980. "the impact structured data throughout computer-based information systems." in: information processing 80, 1980. 1980. "the role data model approach data structures." in; international conference data bases, march 24, 1980. 1982. "toward complete reference model computer-based information systems." co-authored ronald g. ross. in: computers standards 1, 1982. 1983. "the structuring capabilities molecular data model." in; entity-relationship approach software engineering. c. g. davis, s. jajodia, r. t. yeh. eds. june 1983. 1987. "a case adaptable programming." in: logic vol. 2, no. 1, spring 1987. 1989. "a personal chronicle: creating better information systems, guiding principles." in: ieee transactions knowledge data engineering vol. 1, no. 1, march 1989. retirement, bachman volunteered help record history early software development. 2002 gave lecture computer history museum assembling integrated data store, oral history acm 2004. bachman papers 1951 2007 available charles babbage institute university minnesota. 2011, contributed oral history institute electrical electronics engineers. == see also == bachman diagram navigational database == references ==

Content: john warner backus (december 3, 1924 – march 17, 2007) american computer scientist. led team invented implemented fortran, first widely used high-level programming language, inventor backus–naur form (bnf), widely used notation define syntaxes formal languages. later research function-level programming paradigm, presenting findings influential 1977 turing award lecture "can programming liberated von neumann style?" ieee awarded backus w. w. mcdowell award 1967 development fortran. received national medal science 1975 1977 turing award "for profound, influential, lasting contributions design practical high-level programming systems, notably work fortran, publication formal procedures specification programming languages". john backus retired 1991. died home ashland, oregon march 17, 2007. == early life == backus born philadelphia grew nearby wilmington, delaware. studied hill school pottstown, pennsylvania, apparently diligent student. entered college university virginia study chemistry, struggled classes there, expelled less year poor attendance. subsequently conscripted u.s. army world war ii, eventually came hold rank corporal, put command anti-aircraft battery stationed fort stewart, georgia. receiving high scores military aptitude test, army sent study engineering university pittsburgh. later transferred pre-medical program haverford college. internship hospital, diagnosed cranial bone tumor, successfully removed, plate installed head. moved flower fifth avenue medical school medical school, found uninteresting dropped nine months. soon underwent second operation replace metal plate head one design, received honorable medical discharge u.s. army 1946. == fortran == moving new york city trained initially radio technician became interested mathematics. graduated columbia university bachelor's degree 1949 master's degree 1950, mathematics, joined ibm 1950. first three years, worked selective sequence electronic calculator (ssec); first major project write program calculate positions moon. 1953, backus developed language speedcoding, first high-level language created ibm computer, aid software development ibm 701 computer. programming difficult time, 1954 backus assembled team define develop fortran ibm 704 computer. fortran first high-level programming language put broad use. widely used language made computers practical accessible machines scientists others without requiring deep knowledge machinery. == backus–naur form == backus served international committees developed algol 58 influential algol 60, quickly became de facto worldwide standard publishing algorithms. backus developed backus–naur form (bnf), published unesco report algol 58. formal notation able describe context-free programming language, important development compilers. deviations approach tried (notably lisp apl), 1970s, backus–naur context-free specifications computer languages become quite standard, following development automated compiler generators yacc. contribution helped backus win turing award 1977. == function-level programming == backus later worked function-level programming language known fp, described turing award lecture "can programming liberated von neumann style?". sometimes viewed backus's apology creating fortran, paper less garner interest fp language spark research functional programming general. backus publicized function-level style programming, message mostly misunderstood traditional functional programming style languages. fp strongly inspired kenneth e. iverson's apl, even using non-standard character set. fp interpreter distributed 4.2bsd unix operating system, relatively implementations language, used educational purposes. backus spent latter part career developing fl (from "function level"), successor fp. fl internal ibm research project, development language stopped project finished. papers documenting remain, source code compiler described made public. fl odds functional programming languages developed 1980s, based lambda calculus static typing systems instead of, apl, concatenation primitive operations. many language's ideas implemented versions j programming language, iverson's successor apl. == awards honors == named ibm fellow (1963) w. w. mcdowell award (1967) national medal science (1975) turing award (1977) fellow american academy arts sciences (1985) doctor honoris causa université henri-poincaré (1989) draper prize (1993) computer history museum fellow award "for development fortran, contributions computer systems theory software
