Name: Victor Bahl
Content: victor bahl (born 1964 (age 59–60)) american technical fellow cto azure operators microsoft. started networking research microsoft. known research contributions white space radio data networks, radio signal-strength based indoor positioning systems, multi-radio wireless systems, wireless network virtualization, edge computing, bringing wireless links datacenter. also known leadership mobile computing community co-founder acm special interest group mobility systems, users, data, computing (sigmobile). founder international conference mobile systems, applications, services conference (mobisys), founder acm mobile computing communications review, quarterly scientific journal publishes peer-reviewed technical papers, opinion columns, news stories related wireless communications mobility. bahl received important awards; delivered dozens keynotes plenary talks conferences workshops; delivered six dozen distinguished seminars universities; written hundred papers 65,000 citations awarded 100 us international patents. fellow association computing machinery, ieee, american association advancement science. == life industry == bahl began professional career 1988 engineer image processing research group digital equipment corporation maynard, massachusetts. 1990, developed computer industry's first video compression image rendering software library shipped every ultrix vms computer. 1990 1992, worked jvideo hardware prototype (and later j300), turbochannel based multimedia board manipulating digital video personal workstations. following success project, 1993, group shipped fullvideo fullvideo supreme, industry's first multimedia hardware product vax-, alpha-, pentium-based workstations. fullvideo used two c-cube cl 550 chips simultaneous compression decompression jpeg streams, motorola dsp5001 cd quality audio, propriety blue noise based image renderer. 1994, bahl awarded two-year doctoral fellowship dec, enabled complete phd degree university massachusetts, amherst. 1997, joined microsoft research redmond, washington developed first wi-fi based indoor positioning system first public area wi-fi hot spot. 2001 formed networking research group 2010 mobility & networking research group. group considered one strongest respected networking research group world. bahl advises microsoft's ceo senior leadership team long-term vision strategy related networking technologies. group execute strategy research, technology transfers product groups, industry partnerships, associated policy engagement governments research institutions around world. years group developed technologies campus-wide white space networking, wireless zero-configuration, native wi-fi, virtual wi-fi, firmware tpm, xbox wireless controller protocol. group also known complete re-design azure global data center network architecture foundational components, including azure’s software load balancer, azure’s software-defined wide-area network, data center tcp, recently, azure’s remote direct memory access network. 2020, victor moved azure operators cto. thought leader microsoft's azure operators strategy. == research contributions == === white space radio communications === leader microsoft's networking white spaces (knows) project, bahl led worldwide effort harness relatively unused spectra (tv white space) using fundamentally different approach (opportunistic sharing spectrum) previous allocations. 2007 group built first tv white space radio, tested federal communications commission; 2009, carried first us tests whitespace radio communications; april 7, 2010, part ieee dyspan conference keynote talk, announced free availability white space spectrum database research. august 14, 2010, bahl microsoft's chief research strategy officer craig mundie hosted u.s. federal communications commission (fcc) chairman julius genachowski fcc managing director steven van roekei microsoft's redmond campus. meeting, bahl presented details white space networking technology group demonstrated world's first campus-wide tv white space network. one month later, september 23, 2010, fcc made historic ruling opened 180 mhz spectrum unlicensed use united states another subsequent ruling made spectrum sensing non-mandatory requirement, decision expected key reason success technology. following fcc's lead, spectrum regulatory bodies several countries passed similar rulings. bahl's efforts covered extensively mainstream media. group published several seminal papers including best paper sigcomm 2009 titled “white space networking wi-fi like connectivity”. publications triggered wave research dynamic spectrum access. since bahl continued pursue line research, incorporating newer technologies smart antennas, mimo, software defined radios wide area unlicensed networks. === indoor positioning === bahl developed radar indoor positioning system, world's first rf signal strength based indoor location determination system. basic premise operation record signal strength information multiple wi-fi access points database initial training phase. signal strengths nearby access points (a fingerprint) stored database. operation, mobile makes ap signal strength measurements queries database find closest location match. refinements combine empirical measurements environmental profiling, mobility modeling, topographical constraints locate track mobiles. bahl collaborators awarded 12 u.s. international patents work. === wi-fi public area hotspots === bahl designed deployed world's first free public area wi-fi hotspot network crossroads shopping center bellevue, washington 11 june 1999. network known crown, short crossroads wireless network, operational two years retired 14 june 2001. time telecommunications industry vigorously pushing 3g networks, crown demonstrated wi-fi hotspots could inexpensive alternative cellular internet access. crown's edge server architecture supported important features network discovery, global authentication, differentiated services, last hop cryptographic security, location-based services. design accompanying protocols influenced internet engineering task force (ietf) working groups companies deploying wi-fi hot-spots. centralized dumb access point smart switch architecture deployed enterprise wi-fi networks also traced back crown. bahl published influential papers awarded several us patents inventions (united states patents: 6,834,341, 7,032,241, 7,089,415, 7,085,924, 7,149,896, 7,313,237, 7,406,707, 7,444,510, 7,444,669, 7,500,263, 7,548,976). === wireless community meshes === community-based multi-hop wireless networking disruptive force mainstream dsl cable modem wireline networks. true spirit internet, allows free flow information without moderation selective rate control (see network neutrality). 2003 2007, bahl team microsoft research invented several important technologies made wireless mesh networking feasible. research, highly publicized mainstream press, popularized idea community networks would grow organically neighbors connect home wi-fi networks together via wireless meshes. mitigate loss throughput, fundamental meshes half-duplex radios, bahl departed norm became first researcher build wireless meshes multi-radio nodes. subsequently, group developed multi-radio routing algorithms took advantage extract better performance. also built networks split control data plane different frequencies developed troubleshooting technologies enabled self-manage self-stabilize. 2005 2007 developed distributed open source academic toolkits used teaching research aid 1200 universities worldwide. published several scientific papers, gave tutorials keynote talks, microsoft licensed technology start-ups. speed adoption provide broadband internet access rural areas poor connectivity, 2006 helped launch microsoft's digital inclusion program provided substantial funding research deployment mesh networks. bahl awarded eight international patents pertaining mesh networking. === wireless network virtualization === bahl brother pradeep bahl (then) phd candidate ranveer chandra co-invented wireless hardware virtualization, enables wi-fi card give illusion connected multiple wireless networks. virtualization software resides network layer osi network stack. switches hardware configuration rapidly automatically causing connect different networks. switching speeds 1 2 milliseconds demand driven switching creates illusion device connected multiple networks simultaneously. first prototype, developed 2002 called multinet. seven years later, 2009, microsoft shipped technology virtual wi-fi millions users windows operating system. virtual wi-fi brought life new scenarios concurrent connection – allowing device communicate ad hoc network connected infra-structure network. technique often used widely popular wi-fi direct. virtual wi-fi also enabled wi-fi networks extend range intermediate node(s) served relay device(s). third popular scenario allows bridging ad hoc networks internet purpose providing localized wi-fi hot-spot. initially released research prototype, software download multinet exceeded several hundred thousand making one popular software downloaded microsoft research's history. virtual wi-fi received many accolades mainstream media copycat versions incorporated several commercial operating systems. === multi-radio wireless systems === 2001, bahl developed first multi-radio personal digital assistant (pda). precursor modern smart phones used two different radios collaboratively dramatically improve network performance voice ip functionality compared popular commercially available single radio wireless pdas. significant new design concept using multiple radios different characteristics device described 2002 mobicom paper, co-authors showed low power radio, rf monolithics tr1000 ash transceiver, connected low power microcontroller, microchip pic16lf877, could used wake-up high-power device, compaq ipaq h3650pda equipped cisco air-pcm350 802.11b wireless networking card, needed basis. configuration increased overall battery lifetime ipaq 115% typical users. following this, 2003 & 2005, bahl wrote series research papers quantifying advantages using multiple radios real-world wireless meshes wireless lans. 2004 paper titled, “reconsidering wireless systems multiple radios,” proposed design principle separating control data planes assigning different radios each. bahl's designs proliferated deeply computer telecommunication industry. early work opened new threads research products awarded least five us patents (7,065,376, 7,099,689, 7,283,834, 7,610,057, 8,078,208). also, 2014, five papers topic cited 2,100 times. === millimeter wave networking data centers === 2008-09, concerned rapidly growing demand cloud computing, industry contemplating converting prevalent multi-rooted tree based network topology, oversubscribed data center networks, fat tree topology non-blocking full bisection bandwidth clos topology. difficulty re-hauling networks complex aggregate layer network switches, required fat tree network topology, thousands simpler commodity network switches inter-connected miles wires required clos network topology, expensive. study production mega data center, published oct. 2009, bahl, kandula, padhye showed barring outliers, traffic demands could met existing, slightly-oversubscribed data center networks. then, manage outliers, augmented small (i.e. low port density) network switches, commonly referred top-of-the-rack tor switches, connect server racks rest network, extremely high frequency point-to-point radio frequency links. notwithstanding concerns link reliability due interference, used short range, highly directional links advantageously, exploiting frequency_reuse light-up many links concurrently interference-free multi-gbps rates. steerable radio beams provided additional inter-rack capacity needed bases thus relieving congestion hot-spots. building network, became first researchers introduce mm-wave (60 ghz) wireless communications data centers. three years later, invention covered new york times article published jan. 14, 2012 titled “a wireless road around data traffic jams.” others followed seminal work developing similar networks. == professional service contributions == past 20 years, bahl keystone figure mobile computing research community, beginning 1995 co-founding (with imrich chlamtac) acm sigmobile, acm's special interest group mobility tetherless ubiquitous connectivity. auspices sigmobile, bahl served steering committee chair flagship conference mobicom, international conference mobile computing networking, since 2001. 2003, bahl brokered deal two largest computer systems organizations (acm usenix) found mobisys, international conference mobile systems, applications, services. mobisys recognized prestigious mobile systems venue world, evidenced paper acceptance rates comparable top publication venues computer science. 1996, bahl founded acm mobile computing communications review, quarterly scientific magazine/newsletter publishes peer-reviewed technical papers, standards reports, rf related health articles, conference workshop reports, opinion columns, news stories, interviews related mobility wireless communications. first issue published april 1997. served first editor-in-chief till june 2001. == education == 1997 phd, electrical computer engineering, university massachusetts, amherst. thesis title: real-time visual communications narrowband wireless radio networks. doctoral fellow digital equipment corporation. master science, electrical computer engineering, university buffalo. thesis title: recognition handwritten script: hidden markov model approach. bachelor science, electrical computer engineering, university buffalo. thesis title: conic shape detection using non-linearized iterative approach. == awards recognition == 1994, received digital equipment corporation's doctoral fellowship award 2001, received acm sigmobile's distinguished service award "in recognition passion effectiveness advancing interests acm sigmobile mobicom” 2003, inducted fellow association computing machinery "for contributions wireless systems, leadership mobile computing communications community" 2007, 2010 2011 awarded microsoft's individual performance awards 2007 2010, served acm distinguished speaker ieee communications society's distinguished lecturer 2008, inducted fellow institute electrical electronics engineers "for contributions design wireless networks systems leadership mobile computing communications" 2008, acm international conference emerging networking experiments technologies (conext) best paper award paper “opportunistic use client repeaters improve performance wlans” 2009, acm sigcomm best paper award paper "white space networking wi-fi like connectivity" 2010, inducted fellow american association advancement science “for distinguished contributions field mobile systems passionate visionary leadership mobile computing community” 2010, ieee region 6 outstanding engineer award 2011, u.s. federal communications commission open internet applications fcc people's choice awards “mobiperf, network measurement system cellular networks” 2012, named distinguished alumnus university massachusetts, amherst 2013, named association computing machinery recipient sigmobile outstanding contributions (lifetime achievement) award “for pioneering contributions wireless internet broadband technologies, inspirational leadership mobile computing community” 2013 ieee region 6 outstanding leadership professional service award 2013, acm mobile systems, applications services (mobisys) best paper award paper “energy characterization optimization image sensing toward continuous mobile vision” 2019, received association computing machinery (acm) distinguished service award “significant lasting service broad community mobile computing wireless networking, building strong linkages academia, industry, government agencies.” 2019, promoted technical fellow microsoft. technical fellow microsoft research redmond lab time. == references == == external links == azure operators (afo) research mobility networking Name: Andrew Barto
Content: andrew g. barto (born c. 1948) american computer scientist, currently professor emeritus computer science university massachusetts amherst. barto best known foundational contributions field modern computational reinforcement learning. == early life education == barto received b.s. distinction mathematics university michigan 1970, initially majored naval architecture engineering. reading work michael arbib mcculloch pitts became interested using computers mathematics model brain, five years later awarded ph.d. computer science thesis cellular automata. == career == 1977, barto joined college information computer sciences university massachusetts amherst postdoctoral research associate, promoted associate professor 1982, full professor 1991. department chair 2007 2011 core faculty member neuroscience behavior program. time umass, barto co-directed autonomous learning laboratory (initially adaptive network laboratory), generated several key ideas reinforcement learning. richard sutton, co-authored influential book reinforcement learning: introduction (mit press 1998; 2nd edition 2018), first phd student. barto graduated 27 phd students, thirteen went become professors. barto published one hundred papers chapters journals, books, conference workshop proceedings. co-author richard sutton book reinforcement learning: introduction, mit press 1998 (2nd edition 2018), co-editor jennie si, warren powell, wunch ii handbook learning approximate dynamic programming, wiley-ieee press, 2004. == awards honors == barto fellow american association advancement science, fellow senior member ieee, member american association artificial intelligence society neuroscience. barto awarded umass neurosciences lifetime achievement award, 2019, ieee neural network society pioneer award 2004, ijcai award research excellence, 2017. citation latter read:professor barto recognized groundbreaking impactful research theory application reinforcement learning. == references == == external links == andrew barto publications indexed google scholar official website

Name: Friedrich L. Bauer
Content: friedrich ludwig "fritz" bauer (10 june 1924 – 26 march 2015) german pioneer computer science professor technical university munich. == life == bauer earned abitur 1942 served wehrmacht world war ii, 1943 1945. 1946 1950, studied mathematics theoretical physics ludwig-maximilians-universität munich. bauer received doctor philosophy (ph.d.) supervision fritz bopp thesis gruppentheoretische untersuchungen zur theorie der spinwellengleichungen ("group-theoretic investigations theory spin wave equations") 1952. completed habilitation thesis über quadratisch konvergente iterationsverfahren zur lösung von algebraischen gleichungen und eigenwertproblemen ("on quadratically convergent iteration methods solving algebraic equations eigenvalue problems") 1954 technical university munich. teaching privatdozent ludwig maximilian university munich 1954 1958, became extraordinary professor applied mathematics university mainz. since 1963, worked professor mathematics (since 1972) computer science technical university munich. retired 1989. == work == bauer's early work involved constructing computing machinery (e.g. logical relay computer stanislaus 1951–1955). context, first propose widely used stack method expression evaluation. bauer member committees developed imperative computer programming languages algol 58, successor algol 60, important predecessors modern imperative programming languages. algol 58, bauer german gesellschaft für angewandte mathematik und mechanik (gamm, society applied mathematics mechanics) worked american association computing machinery (acm). algol 60, bauer international federation information processing (ifip) ifip working group 2.1 algorithmic languages calculi, specified, maintains, supports languages algol 60 algol 68. bauer influential figure establishing computer science independent subject german universities, usually considered part mathematics. 1967, held first lecture computer science german university technical university munich, titled information processing. 1972, computer science become independent academic discipline tum. 1992, separated department mathematics form independent department informatics, though bauer retired chair 1989. 1968, coined term software engineering widespread use since, become discipline computer science. scientific contributions spread numerical analysis (bauer–fike theorem) fundamentals interpretation translation programming languages, later works systematics program development, especially program transformation methods systems (cip-s) associated wide-spectrum language system cip-l. also wrote well-respected book cryptology, decrypted secrets, fourth edition. doctoral advisor 39 students, including rudolf berghammer, manfred broy, david gries, manfred paul, gerhard seegmüller, josef stoer, peter wynn, christoph zenger. friedrich bauer one 19 founding members german informatics society. editor informatik spektrum founding 1978, held position death. friedrich bauer married hildegard bauer-vogg. father three sons two daughters. == definition software engineering == bauer colleague german representative nato science committee. 1967, nato discussing 'the software crisis' bauer suggested term 'software engineering' way conceive problem solution. 1972, bauer published following definition software engineering: "establishment use sound engineering principles economically obtain software reliable works real machines efficiently." == legacy == since 1992, technical university munich awarded friedrich l. bauer prize computer science. 2014, technical university munich renamed largest lecture hall department informatics building him. == awards == 1944: iron cross 2nd class 1968: member bavarian academy sciences mathematics science class 1971: bavarian order merit 1978: wilhelm exner medal (austria). 1982: federal merit cross 1st class 1984: member german academy sciences leopoldina 1986: bavarian maximilian order science art 1987: honorary member society computer science 1988: golden ring honour german museum 1988: ieee computer pioneer award 1997: heinz-maier-leibnitz medal technical university munich 1998: corresponding member austrian academy sciences 2002: honorary member deutsches museum 2004: silver medal merit bavarian academy sciences === honorary doctorates === 1974: honorary doctor university grenoble 1989: honorary doctor university passau 1998: honorary doctorate bundeswehr university munich (neubiberg) == publications == samelson, klaus; bauer, friedrich ludwig (february 1960). "sequential formula translation". communications acm. 3 (2): 76–83. doi:10.1145/366959.366968. s2cid 16646147., influential paper compilers baumann, richard [in german]; feliciano, manuel; bauer, friedrich ludwig; samelson, klaus (1964). introduction algol – primer non-specialist, emphasizing practical uses algorithmic language. series automatic computation. englewood cliffs, new jersey, usa: prentice-hall, inc. isbn 0-13-477828-6. lccn 64-10740. ark:/13960/t6qz35p37. retrieved 2022-10-23. bauer, friedrich ludwig (1987). munich project cip: volume ii: programme transformation system cip-s (lecture notes computer science). springer. isbn 978-3-5401-8779-0. bauer, friedrich ludwig; wirsing, martin (march 1991). elementare aussagenlogik (in german). berlin – heidelberg, germany: springer-verlag. isbn 3-540-52974-8. bauer, friedrich ludwig (2006). decrypted secrets: methods maxims cryptology, 4th edition. new york, usa: springer. isbn 978-3-5402-4502-5. == references == == external links == oral history interview friedrich l. bauer, charles babbage institute, university minnesota. bauer discusses education early research, including european side development algol, well later work numerical analysis programming languages. photograph friedrich l. bauer (provided brian randell) bauer rutishauser symposium eth zürich 2002 friedrich l. bauer mathematics genealogy project author profile database zbmath

Name: Rudolf Bayer
Content: rudolf bayer (born 3 march 1939) german computer scientist. professor emeritus informatics technical university munich employed since 1972. noted inventing three data sorting structures: b-tree (with edward m. mccreight), ub-tree (with volker markl) red–black tree. bayer recipient 2001 acm sigmod edgar f. codd innovations award. 2005 elected fellow gesellschaft für informatik. == references == == external links == technical university munich page

Name: Gordon Bell
Content: chester gordon bell (august 19, 1934 – may 17, 2024) american electrical engineer manager. early employee digital equipment corporation (dec), 1960–1966, bell designed several pdp machines later served company's vice president engineering 1972–1983, overseeing development vax computer systems. bell's later career included roles entrepreneur, investor, founding assistant director nsf's computing information science engineering directorate 1986–1987, researcher emeritus microsoft research 1995–2015. == early life education == gordon bell born kirksville, missouri. grew helping family business, bell electric, repairing appliances wiring homes. bell received bs (1956), ms (1957) electrical engineering mit. went new south wales university technology (now unsw) australia fulbright scholarship 1957–58, taught classes computer design, programmed one first computers arrive australia (called utecom, english electric deuce), published first academic paper. returning us, worked mit speech computation laboratory professor ken stevens, wrote first analysis synthesis program. == career == === digital equipment corporation === dec founders ken olsen harlan anderson recruited new company 1960, designed i/o subsystem pdp-1, including first uart. bell architect pdp-4, pdp-6. architectural contributions pdp-5 pdp-11 unibus general registers architecture. dec, bell went carnegie mellon university 1966 teach computer science. 1972, returned dec 1972 vice-president engineering, charge successful vax computer. === entrepreneur policy advisor === bell reportedly later came find work dec stressful, suffered heart attack march 1983. recovered shortly returned work, resigned company summer. afterwards, founded encore computer, one first shared memory, multiple-microprocessor computers use snooping cache structure. 1980s became involved public policy, becoming first founding assistant director cise directorate nsf, led cross-agency group specified nren. bell also established acm gordon bell prize (administered acm ieee) 1987 encourage development parallel processing. first gordon bell prize researchers parallel processing division sandia national laboratory work done 1000-processor ncube 10 hypercube. founding member ardent computer 1986, becoming vp r&d 1988, remained merged stellar 1989, become stardent computer. === microsoft research === 1991 1995, bell advised microsoft efforts start research group, joined full-time august 1995, studying telepresence related ideas. experiment subject mylifebits project, experiment life-logging (not life-blogging). attempt fulfill vannevar bush's vision automated store documents, pictures (including taken automatically), sounds individual experienced lifetime, accessed speed ease. this, bell digitized documents read produced, cds, emails, on. == death == bell died aspiration pneumonia home coronado, california, may 17, 2024. 89. == bell's law computer classes == bell's law computer classes first described 1972 emergence new, lower priced microcomputer class based microprocessor. established market class computers introduced constant price increasing functionality performance. technology advances semiconductors, storage, interfaces networks enable new computer class (platform) form every decade serve new need. new usually lower priced class maintained quasi independent industry (market). classes include: mainframes (1960s), minicomputers (1970s), networked workstations personal computers (1980s), browser-web-server structure (1990s), palmtop computing (1995), web services (2000s), convergence cell phones computers (2003), wireless sensor networks aka motes (2004). bell predicted home body area networks would form 2010. == legacy honors == bell described "a giant computer industry", "an architect digital age", "father minicomputer". bell elected member national academy engineering 1977 contributions architecture minicomputers. also fellow american academy arts sciences (1994), american association advancement science (1983), association computing machinery (1994), ieee (1974), member national academy sciences (2007), fellow australian academy technological sciences engineering (2009). also member advisory board tti/vanguard former member sector advisory committee australia's information communication technology division commonwealth scientific industrial research organisation. bell first recipient ieee john von neumann medal, 1992. awards include fellow computer history museum, aea inventor award, vladimir karapetoff outstanding technical achievement award eta kappa nu, 1991 national medal technology president george h. w. bush. also named eta kappa nu eminent member 2007. 1993, worcester polytechnic institute awarded bell honorary doctor engineering, 2010, bell received honorary doctor science technology degree carnegie mellon university. latter award referred "the father minicomputer". bell co-founded computer museum boston, massachusetts, wife gwen bell 1979. founding board member successor, computer history museum located mountain view, california. 2003, made fellow museum "for key role minicomputer revolution, contributions computer architect entrepreneur". story museum's evolution beginning early 1970s ken olsen digital equipment corporation described microsoft technical report msr-tr-2011-44, "out closet: early years computer [x]* museum". timeline computing historical machines, events, people given website. covers prehistoric times present. == books == (with allen newell) computer structures: readings examples (1971, isbn 0-07-004357-4) (with c. mudge j. mcnamara) computer engineering (1978, isbn 0-932376-00-2) (with dan siewiorek allen newell) computer structures: principles examples (1982, isbn 0-07-057302-6) (with j. mcnamara) high tech ventures: guide entrepreneurial success (1991, isbn 0-201-56321-5) (with jim gemmell) total recall: e-memory revolution change everything (2009, isbn 978-0-525-95134-6) (with jim gemmell) life uploaded: digital way better memory, health, productivity (2010, isbn 978-0-452-29656-5) == see also == mylifebits microsoft sensecam lifelog == references == == reading == wilkinson, alec, "remember this?" new yorker, 28 may 2007, pp. 38–44. == external links == cbs evening news video interview mylifebits project, 2007.

Name: Steven M. Bellovin
Content: steven m. bellovin researcher computer networking security professor computer science department columbia university since 2005. previously, bellovin fellow at&t labs research florham park, Name: Cecilia Berdichevsky
Content: cecilia berdichevsky berdichevski (née tuwjasz) (1925 – 2010) pioneering argentine computer scientist began work 1961 using first ferranti mercury computer country. == biography == born "my darling clementine." 1961, arrived buenos aires england, clementina powerful computer country, cost $300,000 measured 18 metres (59 ft) length. first large computer used scientific purposes country (in year, ibm 1401 installed buenos aires business uses). newly graduated berdichevsky studied computing visiting english software engineer cicely popplewell (famous worked alan turing manchester) spanish mathematician ernesto garcía camarero. popplewell motivated berdichevsky write run first program new computer, required multiple arithmetic calculations. photoelectric device read punched paper ribbon used submit data clementina produced desired result seconds. based berdichevsky's progress argentina, 1962 one two people awarded scholarships continue studies university london's subtraction, multiplication." computer's resources included: machine language, assembler named pig2; high-level programming language (a compiler) called autocode. later another compiler called comic replaced autocode. days, compilers unique written computer; developed use multiple models computers years later. addition, berdichevsky worked head practical works numerical calculus i, tenured professor mentor, manuel sadosky vice-dean faculty exact sciences university buenos aires 1957 1966. === coup d'état === berdichevsky worked sadosky's institute argentine coup d'état installed troops physically beat evicted academic occupiers university buenos aires institutions higher learning. many academics, including sadosky, forced exile. berdichevsky began working accountant. 1966 1970 also one directors scientific technical advisors (act), company formed former academic associates, manuel sadosky, rebeca guber juan chamero. === later years === 1984, berdichevsky became deputy general manager argentine savings bank caja de ahorro charge computer center. also named representative international federation information processing. retirement, continued work computer consultant participated important international projects organizations united nations development program. cecilia berdichevsky died avellaneda, argentina, 28 february 2010. == published work == berdichevsky c. Name: Tim Berners-Lee
Content: sir timothy john berners-lee (born 8 june 1955), also known timbl, english computer scientist best known inventor world wide web, html markup language, url system, http. professorial research fellow university oxford professor emeritus massachusetts institute technology (mit). berners-lee proposed information management system 12 march 1989 implemented first successful communication hypertext transfer protocol (http) client server via internet mid-november. devised implemented first web browser web server helped foster web's subsequent explosive development. founder director world wide web consortium (w3c), oversees continued development web. co-founded (with rosemary leith) world wide web foundation. april 2009, elected foreign associate national academy sciences. berners-lee senior researcher holder 3com founder's chair mit computer science artificial intelligence laboratory (csail). director web science research initiative (wsri) member advisory board mit center collective intelligence. 2011, named member board trustees ford foundation. founder president open data institute currently advisor social network mewe. 2004, berners-lee knighted queen elizabeth ii pioneering work. received 2016 turing award "for inventing world wide web, first web browser, fundamental protocols algorithms allowing web scale". named time magazine's list 100 important people 20th century received number accolades invention. == early life == berners-lee born london 8 june 1955, son mathematicians computer scientists mary lee woods (1924–2017) conway berners-lee (1921–2019). parents birmingham worked ferranti mark 1, first commercially-built computer. paternal grandmother canadian woman winnipeg. three younger siblings; brother, mike, professor ecology climate change management. berners-lee attended sheen mount primary school, attended emanuel school (a direct grant grammar school time) 1969 1973. keen trainspotter child, learnt electronics tinkering model railway. 1973 1976, studied queen's college, oxford, received first-class ba physics. there, made computer old television set purchased repair shop. == career research == graduation, berners-lee worked engineer telecommunications company plessey poole, dorset. 1978, joined d. g. nash ferndown, dorset, helped create typesetting software printers. berners-lee worked independent contractor cern june december 1980. geneva, proposed project based concept hypertext, facilitate sharing updating information among researchers. demonstrate it, built prototype system named enquire. leaving cern late 1980, went work john poole's image computer systems, ltd, bournemouth, dorset. ran company's technical side three years. project worked "real-time remote procedure call" gave experience computer networking. 1984, returned cern fellow. 1989, cern largest internet node europe berners-lee saw opportunity join hypertext internet: take hypertext idea connect tcp dns ideas and—ta-da!—the world wide web. creating web really act desperation, situation without difficult working cern later. technology involved web, like hypertext, like internet, multifont text objects, designed already. put together. step generalising, going higher level abstraction, thinking documentation systems possibly part larger imaginary documentation system. berners-lee wrote proposal march 1989 and, 1990, redistributed it. accepted manager, mike sendall, called proposals "vague, exciting". robert cailliau independently proposed project develop hypertext system cern, joined berners-lee partner efforts get web ground. used similar ideas underlying enquire system create world wide web, berners-lee designed built first web browser. software also functioned editor (called worldwideweb, running nextstep operating system), first web server, cern httpd (short hypertext transfer protocol daemon). berners-lee published first web site, described project itself, 20 december 1990; available internet cern network. site provided explanation world wide web was, people could use browser set web server, well get started website. 6 august 1991, berners-lee first posted, usenet, public invitation collaboration worldwideweb project. list 80 cultural moments shaped world, chosen panel 25 eminent scientists, academics, writers world leaders, invention world wide web ranked number one, entry stating, "the fastest growing communications medium time, internet changed shape modern life forever. connect instantly, world." 1994, berners-lee founded w3c massachusetts institute technology. comprised various companies willing create standards recommendations improve quality web. berners-lee made idea available freely, patent royalties due. world wide web consortium decided standards based royalty-free technology, easily could adopted anyone. berners-lee participated curl corp's attempt develop promote curl programming language. 2001, berners-lee became patron east dorset heritage trust, previously lived colehill wimborne, east dorset. december 2004, accepted chair computer science school electronics computer science, university southampton, hampshire, work semantic web. times article october 2009, berners-lee admitted initial pair slashes ("//") web address "unnecessary". told newspaper easily could designed web addresses without slashes. "there go, seemed like good idea time," said lighthearted apology. === policy work === june 2009, then-british prime minister gordon brown announced berners-lee would work uk government help make data open accessible web, building work power information task force. berners-lee professor nigel shadbolt two key figures behind data.gov.uk, uk government project open almost data acquired official purposes free reuse. commenting opening ordnance survey data april 2010, berners-lee said: "the changes signal wider cultural change government based assumption information public domain unless good reason to—not way around." went say: "greater openness, accountability transparency government give people greater choice make easier individuals get directly involved issues matter them." november 2009, berners-lee launched world wide web foundation (wwwf) order campaign "advance web empower humanity launching transformative programs build local capacity leverage web medium positive change". berners-lee one pioneer voices favour net neutrality, expressed view isps supply "connectivity strings attached", neither control monitor browsing activities customers without expressed consent. advocates idea net neutrality kind human network right: "threats internet, companies governments interfere snoop internet traffic, compromise basic human network rights." berners-lee participated open letter us federal communications commission (fcc). 20 internet pioneers urged fcc cancel vote 14 december 2017 uphold net neutrality. letter addressed senator roger wicker, senator brian schatz, representative marsha blackburn representative michael f. doyle. berners-lee honoured "inventor world wide web" 2012 summer olympics opening ceremony appeared working vintage next computer. tweeted "this everyone" appeared led lights attached chairs audience. berners-lee joined board advisors start-up state.com, based london. may 2012, president open data institute, co-founded nigel shadbolt 2012. alliance affordable internet (a4ai) launched october 2013, berners-lee leading coalition public private organisations includes google, facebook, intel microsoft. a4ai seeks make internet access affordable access broadened developing world, 31% people online. berners-lee work aiming decrease internet access prices fall un broadband commission's worldwide target 5% monthly income. berners-lee holds founders chair computer science massachusetts institute technology, heads decentralized information group leading solid, joint project qatar computing research institute aims radically change way web applications work today, resulting true data ownership well improved privacy. october 2016, joined department computer science oxford university professorial research fellow fellow christ church, one oxford colleges. mid-2010s berners-lee initially remained neutral emerging encrypted media extensions (eme) proposal controversial digital rights management (drm) implications. march 2017 felt take position support eme proposal. reasoned eme's virtues whilst noting drm inevitable. w3c director, went approve finalised specification july 2017. stance opposed including electronic frontier foundation (eff), anti-drm campaign defective design free software foundation. varied concerns raised included supportive internet's open philosophy commercial interests risks users forced use particular web browser view specific drm content. eff raised formal appeal succeed eme specification became formal w3c recommendation september 2017. 30 september 2018, berners-lee announced new open-source startup inrupt fuel commercial ecosystem around solid project, aims give users control personal data lets choose data goes, who's allowed see certain elements apps allowed see data. november 2019 internet governance forum berlin berners-lee wwwf launched contract web, campaign initiative persuade governments, companies citizens commit nine principles stop "misuse", warning "if act – act together – prevent web misused want exploit, divide undermine, risk squandering [its potential good]". === awards honours === berners-lee received many awards honours. knighted queen elizabeth ii 2004 new year honours "for services global development internet", invested formally 16 july 2004. 13 june 2007, appointed order merit (om), order restricted 24 living members, plus honorary members. bestowing membership order merit within personal purview sovereign require recommendation ministers prime minister. elected fellow royal society (frs) 2001. also elected member british cultural figures life admires mark 80th birthday. 2013, awarded inaugural queen elizabeth prize engineering. 4 april 2017, received 2016 association computing machinery's turing award invention world wide web, first web browser, fundamental protocols algorithms. == personal life == berners-lee said "i like keep work personal life separate." berners-lee married nancy carlson, american computer programmer, 1990. also working switzerland world health organization. two children divorced 2011. 2014, married rosemary leith chapel royal, st. james's palace london. leith canadian internet banking entrepreneur founding director berners-lee's world wide web foundation. couple also collaborate venture capital support artificial intelligence companies. berners-lee raised anglican, turned away religion youth. became parent, became unitarian universalist (uu). asked whether believes god, stated: "not sense people, i'm atheist unitarian universalist." web's source code auctioned helicopter pilot charles "cheater" bella, amazon lawyer elizabeth korrell, local rancher ty holland. survived; bezos sustained minor injuries discharged local hospital day. bezos portrayed starfleet official 2016 movie star trek beyond, joined cast crew san diego comic-con screening. lobbied paramount role apropos alexa personal/professional interest speech recognition. one line consisted response alien distress: "speak normally." initial discussion project became alexa technical advisor greg hart 2011, bezos told goal create "the star trek computer." bezos's family corporation zefram llc named zefram cochrane, character star trek. january 2019, bezos wife mackenzie released joint statement revealed would getting divorced 25 years together. subsequently, national enquirer revealed bezos affair media personality lauren sánchez; affair sánchez lasted months. later, bezos published online essay february 7, 2019, accused american media, inc. owner david pecker "extortion blackmail" threatening publish intimate photos bezos current girlfriend lauren sánchez stop investigation text messages photos leaked national enquirer. media reports accused sánchez's brother michael source photos obtained national enquirer; however, bezos speculated may saudi arabian government. april 4, 2019, divorce finalized, bezos keeping 75% couple's amazon stock mackenzie getting remaining 25% ($35.6 billion) amazon stock. however, bezos would keep couple's voting rights. may 22, 2023, sánchez bezos became engaged. honorary chair explorers club. == politics == according public campaign finance records, bezos supported electoral campaigns patty murray maria cantwell, two democratic u.s. senators washington. also supported democrats u.s. representative john conyers, well patrick leahy republican spencer abraham, u.s. senators serving committees dealing internet-related issues. jeff bezos mackenzie bezos supported legalization same-sex marriage, 2012 contributed $2.5 million washington united marriage, group supporting yes vote washington referendum 74, affirmed same-sex marriage law enacted state. bezos donated $100,000 towards movement washington state income tax 2010 "top earners". 2012, donated amazon's political action committee (pac), given $56,000 $74,500 democrats republicans, respectively. 2016 presidential election, bezos invited join donald trump's defense innovation advisory board, advisory council improve technology used defense department. trump repeatedly criticized bezos via twitter, accused bezos avoiding corporate taxes, gaining undue political influence, undermining presidency spreading "fake news". 2014, amazon bid cloud computing contract cia valued $600 million. 2018, $10 billion contract known joint enterprise defense infrastructure (jedi) project, time pentagon, allegedly written way favors amazon. controversy raised general james mattis accepted headquarters tour invitation bezos co-ordinated deal sally donnelly, lobbyist previously worked amazon. november 2019, contract awarded microsoft instead, amazon filed lawsuit allegations bidding process biased. july 6, 2021, pentagon cancelled jedi contract microsoft, citing "due evolving requirements, increased cloud conversancy, industry advances, jedi cloud contract longer meets needs." despite bezos's support open borders policy towards immigrants, amazon actively marketed facial recognition software u.s. immigration customs enforcement (ice). 2019, political action committee linked bezos spent $1 million unsuccessful attempt defeat reelection bid seattle city council member activist kshama sawant. november 22, 2021, jeff bezos donated $100 million obama foundation "help expand scope programming reaches emerging leaders", requested obama presidential center's plaza named john lewis. === saudi hacking claim === march 2018, bezos met seattle mohammad bin salman, crown prince de facto ruler saudi arabia, discuss investment opportunities saudi vision 2030. march 2019, bezos's security consultant accused saudi government hacking bezos's phone. according bbc, bezos's top security staffer, gavin de becker, "linked hack washington post's coverage murder saudi writer jamal khashoggi saudi consulate istanbul". khashoggi, saudi journalist dissident employed writer washington post, owned bezos. khashoggi killed late 2018 turkey's saudi consulate critical stance journalism saudi government leader. january 2020, guardian reported hack initiated murder khashoggi wrote critically crown prince washington post. forensic analysis bezos's mobile phone conducted advisory firm fti consulting, concluded "highly probable" hack achieved using malicious file hidden video sent whatsapp message bezos personal account crown prince may 1, 2018. saudi arabia denied claim. == philanthropy == bezos donated fred hutchinson cancer research center several times 2009 2017. 2013, pledged $500,000 worldreader, non-profit founded former amazon employee. september 2018, business insider reported bezos one top five billionaires world signed giving pledge, initiative created bill gates warren buffett encourages wealthy people give away majority wealth. month, janet camarena, director transparency initiatives foundation center, quoted cnbc questions bezos's new day 1 fund, including fund's structure exactly funded. may 2017, bezos gave $1 million reporters committee freedom press, provides pro bono legal services american journalists. june 15, 2017, posted message twitter asking ideas philanthropy: "i'm thinking philanthropy strategy opposite mostly spend time—working long term". time post, bezos's lifetime spending charitable causes estimated $100 million. multiple opinion columnists responded asking bezos pay higher wages amazon warehouse workers. year later june, tweeted would announce two philanthropic foci end summer 2018. bezos announced september 2018 would commit approximately $2 billion fund deal american homelessness establish network non-profit preschools low income communities. part announcement, committed establishing "day 1 families fund" finance "night shelters day care centers homeless families" "day 1 academies fund" early childhood education. january 2018, bezos made $33 million donation thedream.us, college scholarship fund undocumented immigrants brought united states minors. june 2018, bezos donated breakthrough energy ventures, private philanthropic fund founded bill gates aimed promoting emissions-free energy. september 2018, bezos donated $10 million honor, nonpartisan organization works increase number veterans political office. february 2020, bezos pledged $10 billion combat climate change bezos earth fund. later year, november, bezos announced $791m donations established, well-known groups, $100m going environmental defense fund, natural resources defense council, nature conservancy, world resources institute world wildlife fund, remainder going 11 groups. april 2020, early covid-19 pandemic, bezos donated $100 million food banks feeding america. november 2021, bezos pledged donate $2 billion towards restructuring food systems nature conservation 2021 united nations climate change conference. july 2021, bezos announced courage civility award donated $100 million lawyer van jones chef josé andrés. next year, $100-million singer dolly parton recognition charity work focused improving children's literacy around world. march 2024, donated $50 million actress eva longoria retired admiral bill mcraven. bezos academy group tuition-free preschools students low-income families, created bezos, operate manner similar montessori method (but accredited montessori schools). november 22, 2022, jeff bezos awarded $123 million organizations engaged relocating homeless families permanent housing. day 1 families fund grants, amounts vary monetary terms, sent 40 organizations across country. == see also == list princeton university alumni list richest Name: Abhay Bhushan
Content: abhay bhushan (hindi pronunciation: [əbʰəj bʰuːʂəɳː]; born 23 november 1944) indian computer scientist. bhushan major contributor development internet tcp/ip architecture, author file transfer protocol (which started working student mit) early versions email standards. currently chairman asquare inc., secretary indians collective action former president iit-kanpur foundation. 2023, inducted internet hall fame. == early life career == abhay bhushan born allahabad, uttar pradesh. bhushan graduate first batch (1960–65) indian institute technology kanpur, receiving b.tech. electrical engineering. subsequently, studied massachusetts institute technology, received masters electrical engineering together degree management mit sloan school management. mit, drafted famous rfc 114 worked developing ftp e-mail protocols arpanet subsequent internet. 1978 director institute engineering rural technology allahabad also senior manager engineering development xerox founder manager xerox environmental leadership. also co-founder yieldup international 1995 went public nasdaq portola communications, bought netscape 1997. == references ==

Name: Dines Bjørner
Content: professor dines bjørner (born 4 october 1937, odense) danish computer scientist. specializes research domain engineering, requirements engineering formal methods. worked cliff jones others vienna development method (vdm) ibm laboratory vienna (and elsewhere). later involved producing raise (rigorous approach industrial software engineering) formal method tool support. bjørner professor technical university denmark (dtu) 1965–1969 1976–2007, retired march 2007. responsible establishing united nations university international institute software technology (unu-iist), macau, 1992 first director. magnum opus software engineering (three volumes) appeared 2005/6. support vdm, bjørner co-founded vdm-europe, subsequently became formal methods europe, organization supports conferences related activities. 2003, instigated associated fortia formal techniques industry association. bjørner became knight order dannebrog 1985. received dr.h.c. masaryk university, brno, czech republic 2004. 2021, obtained dr. techn. technical university denmark, kongens lyngby, denmark. fellow ieee (2004) acm (2005). also member academia europaea since 1989. 2007, symposium held macau honour dines bjørner zhou chaochen. 2021, bjørner elected formal methods europe (fme) fellowship. bjørner married kari bjørner, two children five grandchildren. == selected books == domain science engineering: foundation software development, bjørner, d. monographs theoretical computer science, eatcs series, springer nature. hardcover isbn 978-3-030-73483-1; softcover isbn 978-3-030-73486-2; ebook isbn 978-3-030-73484-8 (2021). software engineering 1: abstraction modelling, bjørner, d. texts theoretical computer science, eatcs series, springer-verlag. isbn 3-540-21149-7 (2005). software engineering 2: specification systems languages, bjørner, d. texts theoretical computer science, eatcs series, springer-verlag. isbn 3-540-21150-0 (2006). software engineering 3: domains, requirements, software design, bjørner, d. texts theoretical computer science, eatcs series, springer-verlag. isbn 3-540-21151-9 (2006). formal specification software development, bjørner, d. jones, c.b. prentice hall international series computer science, prentice hall. isbn 0-13-329003-4 (1982). vienna development method: meta-language, bjørner, d. jones, c.b. (editors). lecture notes computer science, volume 61, springer-verlag. isbn 3-540-08766-4 (1978). == see also == international journal software informatics == references == == external links == home page biographical information raise information dines bjørner dblp bibliography server dines bjørner publications indexed microsoft academic

Name: Gerrit Blaauw
Content: gerrit anne "gerry" blaauw (july 17, 1924 – march 21, 2018) dutch computer scientist, known one principal designers ibm system/360 line computers, together fred brooks, gene amdahl, others. == biography == born hague, netherlands, blaauw received ba delft university technology 1946. 1947, blaauw exclusive scholarship funded ibm chief executive officer thomas j. watson. initial year lafayette college pennsylvania, blaauw studied harvard university. received 1949 phd 1952 supervision howard aiken, inventor early mark computer. harvard, worked design mark iii mark iv computers. blaauw met fred brooks working ibm visited harvard, fred brooks graduate student. graduation 1952, blaauw returned netherlands worked mathematical centre second arra computer. 1955 returned united states work ibm's poughkeepsie labs worked brooks number projects: designer ibm 7030 stretch project. worked ill-fated ibm 8000 series, particular designed paging system ibm 8106 1960-1961 period. key engineer ibm system/360 project, announced 1964. among contributions, blaauw made successful case 8-bit (as opposed 6-bit) computer architecture. blaauw also designed revolutionary address translation system, "blaauw box", removed original system/360 design, later used ibm's unsuccessful proposal mit's project mac. subsequently, dynamic address translation (dat) hardware somewhat different design incorporated important ibm system/360-67 computer. implemented model 67, dat hardware allowed implementation first practical paged virtual memory systems – perhaps first commercially successful. model 67 used commercial applications 1968. earlier ferranti atlas computer seminal platform paging research, suffered well-studied performance issues thrashing. virtual memory address translation capabilities similar s/360-67 subsequently included models ibm system/370 computer line followed. leaving ibm, blaauw became computer science professor netherlands. retired 1989 professor emeritus universiteit twente. 1982 elected member royal netherlands academy arts sciences. 1997 co-authored computer architecture: concepts evolution brooks. blaauw died utrecht. blaauw devout christian gave particular attention, especially retirement, relationship science faith, topic explored booklet available english, dutch spanish. == selected publications == blaauw, gerrit a. digital system implementation. prentice hall ptr, 1976. blaauw, gerrit a., frederick p. brooks jr. computer architecture: concepts evolution. addison-wesley longman publishing co., inc., 1997. blaauw, gerrit a. scripture science: unexpected harmony. 2014. published online. (archived 2018) selected articles brooks, frederick p., gerrit a. blaauw, wilfried buchholz. "processing data bits pieces." ire transactions electronic computers 2 (1959): 118-124. amdahl, g. m.; blaauw, g. a.; brooks, f. p. (1964). "architecture ibm system/360". ibm journal research development. 8 (2): 87–101. citeseerx 10.1.1.72.7974. doi:10.1147/rd.82.0087. blaauw, gerrit a., frederick p. brooks jr. "the structure system/360: part i—outline logical structure." ibm systems journal 3.2 (1964): 119-135. patents amdahl, gene m., et al. "data processing system." u.s. patent no. 3,400,371. 3 sep. 1968. == references == == reading == pugh, emerson w.; lyle r. johnson; john h. palmer (1991). ibm's 360 early 370 systems. cambridge, london: mit press. isbn 0-262-16123-0. [extensive (819 pp.) treatment ibm's offerings period. blaauw mentioned numerous pages.] == external links == gerrit blaauw archived 2011-07-24 wayback machine, unsung heroes dutch computing history. diesrede blaauw: beschrijven en begrijpen 26 november 1976 (in dutch)

Name: Dorothy Blum
Content: dorothy toplitzky blum (february 21, 1924 – october 1980) american computer scientist cryptanalyst. worked national security agency predecessors 1944 death 1980. == early life == dorothy toplitzky born 1924 new york city austro-hungarian immigrant parents. == career == graduating brooklyn college 1944, joined cryptologic unit u.s. army. unit focused cryptanalysis, study analyzing information systems gain access hidden aspects systems, case, axis powers' encrypted messages. world war ii, worked united states armed forces security agency later national security agency (nsa). time nsa 1950s, blum tasked "keep[ing] abreast latest advances field computing" recommended computer technologies could adapted cryptanalysis communications intelligence. included use fortran programing language beginning three years public release 1957. wrote computer software nsa spearheaded effort teach nsa employees write cryptanalytic programs. throughout 1960s 1970s, blum continued work field computer science, helping design nsa's computer systems automate processes. 1972, became chief nsa computer operations organization (c7), woman time organization's management hierarchy. appointed chief plans project development organization (t4) telecommunications computer services organization 1977. also involved women nsa (win) group. == legacy == blum died cancer october 1980, aged 56. internal award nsa - dorothy blum award excellence employee personal professional development - named her. 2004, inducted nsa hall honor. official nsa biography states that, 36-year career, blum "significantly changed way nsa cryptanalysis." also elected one top 100 "most outstanding women federal government." == personal life == 1950, married nsa mathematician joseph blum, later son, david blum. == references ==

Name: Lenore Blum
Content: lenore carol blum (née epstein, born december 18, 1942) american computer scientist mathematician made contributions theories real number computation, cryptography, pseudorandom number generation. distinguished career professor computer science carnegie mellon university 2019 currently professor residence university california, berkeley. also known efforts increase diversity mathematics computer science. == early life education == blum born jewish family new york city, mother science teacher. moved venezuela blum nine. graduating venezuelan high school age 16, studied architecture carnegie institute technology (now carnegie mellon university) beginning 1959. assistance alan perlis, shifted fields mathematics 1960. married manuel blum, student massachusetts institute technology, transferred 1961 simmons college, private women's liberal arts college boston. simmons strong mathematics program eventually able take isadore singer's mathematics classes mit, graduating simmons b.s. mathematics 1963. received ph.d. mathematics massachusetts institute technology 1968. dissertation, generalized algebraic theories: model theoretic approach, supervised gerald sacks. switched advised sacks unable follow earlier advisor move princeton university because, time, princeton accept female graduate students. == career == completing doctorate, blum went university california berkeley work julia robinson postdoctoral fellow lecturer mathematics. however, department permanent positions women, two years, position lecturer renewed. 1971 became one founders association women mathematics.[awm] 1973 joined faculty mills college, women's college oakland hills near berkeley. 1974 founded mathematics computer science department mills, time computer science program women's college. served head co-head department 13 years. 1975 1978 served third president association women mathematics.[awm] following this, blum elected member large council ams, serving 1978 1980. 1979 awarded endowed professorship, first letts-villard chair mills. 1983 blum national science foundation visiting professorship women award work michael shub two years cuny graduate center. 1987 spent year ibm. 1992 blum became deputy director mathematical sciences research institute (msri), working director william thurston. visiting city university hong kong 1996–1998 work book complexity real computation (during hong kong's handover british chinese rule), became distinguished career professor computer science carnegie mellon university (cmu) 1999. cmu, took philosophy low numbers women majoring computer science part caused vicious cycle: women, women computer science fewer support networks (such friends major help coursework) men. factors made computer scientist less pleasant difficult women, fewer women chose major computer science. instead then-popular approach changing curriculum application-centric hope attracting women, pushed maintain traditional computer science program change culture surrounding program welcoming. support goal, founded women@scs program cmu, provided mentoring outreach opportunities women computer science. program, came directed blum's student carol frieze, cmu able increase proportion women undergraduate computer science program nearly 50%. blum also founded project olympus cmu, business incubator program led many startups pittsburgh associated cmu computer program. resigned cmu 2018 (effective august 2019) change management structure project olympus led sexist treatment exclusion women project activities. == research == blum blum shub pseudorandom number generator, published jointly blum, manuel blum, michael shub, based operation squaring numbers modulo products two large primes. security reduced computational hardness assumption integer factorization infeasible.[bbs] blum also known blum–shub–smale machine, theoretical model computation real numbers. blum co-authors, michael shub stephen smale, showed (analogously theory turing machines) one define analogues np-completeness, undecidability, universality model. instance, model undecidable determine whether given point belongs mandelbrot set.[bss] published book subject,[crc] 1990 gave address international congress mathematicians computational complexity theory real computation. == recognition == 2002, blum selected association women mathematics noether lecturer. 2005, blum recipient presidential award excellence science, mathematics, engineering mentoring, given president george w. bush "for efforts mentor girls women technology fields traditionally underrepresented". given simmons university 2018 distinguished alumnae lifetime achievement award 2018. blum elected fellow american association advancement science 1979. 2012, blum became fellow american mathematical society. 2017 selected fellow association women mathematics inaugural class. included deck playing cards featuring notable women mathematicians published association women mathematics. == personal life == lenore blum married manuel blum mother avrim blum. three mit alumni professors computer science carnegie mellon. == selected publications == == references == == external links == lenore blum's home page

Name: Manuel Blum
Content: manuel blum (born 26 april 1938) venezuelan born american computer scientist received turing award 1995 "in recognition contributions foundations computational complexity theory application cryptography program checking". == education == blum born jewish family venezuela. blum educated mit, received bachelor's degree master's degree electrical engineering 1959 1961 respectively, ph.d. mathematics 1964 supervised marvin minsky. == career == blum worked professor computer science university california, berkeley 2001. 2001 2018, bruce nelson professor computer science carnegie mellon university, wife, lenore blum, also professor computer science. 2002, elected united states national academy sciences. 2006, elected member national academy engineering contributions abstract complexity theory, inductive inference, cryptographic protocols, theory applications program checkers. 2018 wife lenore resigned carnegie mellon university protest sexism change management structure project olympus led sexist treatment director exclusion women project activities. == research == 60s developed axiomatic complexity theory independent concrete machine models. theory based gödel numberings blum axioms. even though theory based machine model yields concrete results like compression theorem, gap theorem, honesty theorem blum speedup theorem. work includes protocol flipping coin telephone, median medians (a linear time selection algorithm), blum blum shub pseudorandom number generator, blum–goldwasser cryptosystem, recently captchas. blum also known advisor many prominent researchers. among ph.d. students leonard adleman, dana angluin, shafi goldwasser, mor harchol-balter, russell impagliazzo, silvio micali, gary miller, moni naor, steven rudich, michael sipser, ronitt rubinfeld, umesh vazirani, vijay vazirani, luis von ahn, ryan williams. == see also == list venezuelans graph isomorphism problem non-interactive zero-knowledge proof quantum coin flipping pancake sorting == references ==

Name: Barry Boehm
Content: barry william boehm (may 16, 1935 – august 20, 2022) american software engineer, distinguished professor computer science, industrial systems engineering; trw professor software engineering; founding director center systems software engineering university southern california. known many contributions area software engineering. 1996, boehm elected member national academy engineering contributions computer software architectures models cost, quality, risk aerospace systems. == biography == boehm born may 16, 1935. received ba mathematics harvard university 1957, ms 1961, phd ucla 1964, mathematics well. also received honorary sc.d. computer science u. massachusetts 2000 software engineering chinese academy sciences 2011. 1955 started working programmer-analyst general dynamics. 1959 switched rand corporation, head information sciences department 1973. 1973 1989 chief scientist defense systems group trw inc. 1989 1992 served within u.s. department defense (dod) director darpa information science technology office, director ddr&e software computer technology office. 1992 trw professor software engineering, computer science department, director, usc center systems software engineering, formerly center software engineering. served board several scientific journals, including ieee transactions software engineering, computer, ieee software, acm computing reviews, automated software engineering, software process, information software technology. == awards == later awards boehm included office secretary defense award excellence 1992, asqc lifetime achievement award 1994, acm distinguished research award software engineering 1997, ieee international stevens award. aiaa fellow, acm fellow, ieee fellow, member national academy engineering (1996). received mellon award excellence mentoring 2005 ieee simon ramo medal 2010. appointed distinguished professor january 13, 2014. awarded incose pioneer award 2019 international council systems engineering significant pioneering contributions field systems engineering. == work == boehm's research interests included software development process modeling, software requirements engineering, software architectures, software metrics cost models, software engineering environments, knowledge-based software engineering. contributions field, according boehm (1997) himself, include "the constructive cost model (cocomo), spiral model software process, theory w (win-win) approach software management requirements determination two advanced software engineering environments: trw software productivity system quantum leap environment". === software versus hardware costs === important 1973 report entitled "ada - project : dod high order language working group" defense advanced research projects agency (darpa), boehm predicted software costs would overwhelm hardware costs. darpa expected predict hardware would remain biggest problem, encouraging invest even larger computers. report inspired change direction computing. === software economics === boehm's 1981 book software engineering economics documents constructive cost model (cocomo). relates software development effort program, person-months (pm), thousand source lines code (ksloc). p = ∗ ( k l c ) b {\displaystyle pm=a*(ksloc)^{b}} calibration constant based project data b exponent software diseconomy scale. note: since man-years interchangeable years, brooks' law applies: adding programmers late project makes later. thus formula best applied stable software development teams completed multiple projects. === spiral model === boehm also created spiral model software development, phases development repeatedly revisited. iterative software development process influenced mbase extreme programming. === wideband delphi === boehm refined delphi method estimation include group iteration, making suitable certain classes problems, software development. variant called wideband delphi method. === incremental commitment model === incremental commitment model (icm) system design, developmental, evolution process 21st century systems. systems' types cover wide range cots based systems "routine" information systems human intensive life safety critical. boehm reconciled icm winwin spiral model incarnation mbase follow-on lean mbase, worked towards incremental commitment model software (icms) adapting existing winwin spiral model support tools. 2008, evolving icm software risk-driven anchor point decisions, proved useful several projects ended unusual life cycle phase sequences. == publications == boehm published 170 articles several books. books, selection: 1978. characteristics software quality. j.r. brown, h. kaspar, m. lipow, g. mcleod, m. merritt, north holland. 1981. software engineering economics. englewood cliffs, nj : prentice-hall, 1981 isbn 0-13-822122-7. — (1989). "software risk management". ghezzi, c.; mcdermid, j. a. (eds.). proceedings 2nd european software engineering conference. esec'89. lncs. vol. 387. pp. 1–19. doi:10.1007/3-540-51635-2_29. isbn 3-540-51635-2. issn 0302-9743. 1996. ada beyond: software policies department defense. national academy press. 2000. software cost estimation cocomo ii. b. boehm, c. abts, a. w. brown, s. chulani, b. clark, e. horowitz, r. madachy, d. reifer, b. steece. upper saddle river, nj : prentice-hall, 2000 isbn 0-13-026692-2. 2007. software engineering: barry boehm's lifetime contributions software development, management research. ed. richard selby. wiley/ieee press, 2007. isbn 0-470-14873-x. 2004. balancing agility discipline: guide perplexed. richard turner. pearson education, inc 2004 isbn 0-321-18612-5. 2014. incremental commitment spiral model: principles practices successful systems software. b. boehm, j. lane, s. koolmanojwong, r. turner. addison-wesley professional, 2014. isbn 0-321-80822-3. articles 1996. "anchoring software process",. in: ieee software, july 1996. 1997. "developing multimedia applications winwin spiral model," a. egyed, j. kwan, r. madachy. in: proceedings, esec/fse 97 acm software engineering notes, november 1997. == references == == external links == barry boehm home page archived 2013-09-24 wayback machine "a view 20th 21st century software engineering" — talk barry boehm

Name: Corrado Böhm
Content: corrado böhm (17 january 1923 – 23 october 2017) italian computer scientist professor emeritus university rome "la sapienza", known especially contributions theory structured programming, constructive mathematics, combinatory logic, lambda calculus, semantics implementation functional programming languages. == work == phd dissertation (in mathematics, eth zurich, 1951; published 1954), böhm describes first time full meta-circular compiler, translation mechanism programming language, written language. influential contribution so-called structured program theorem, published 1966 together giuseppe jacopini. together alessandro berarducci, demonstrated isomorphism strictly-positive algebraic data types polymorphic lambda-terms, otherwise known böhm–berarducci encoding. lambda calculus, established important separation theorem normal forms, known böhm's theorem, states every two closed λ-terms t1 t2 different βη-normal forms, exists term δ δ t1 δ t2 evaluate different free variables (i.e., may taken apart internally). means that, normalizing terms, morris' contextual equivalence, semantic property, may decided equality normal forms, syntactic property, coincides βη-equality. special issue theoretical computer science dedicated 1993, 70th birthday. recipient 2001 eatcs award distinguished career theoretical computer science. == selected publications == c. böhm, "calculatrices digitales. du déchiffrage des formules mathématiques par la machine même dans la conception du programme", annali di mat. pura e applicata, serie iv, tomo xxxvii, 1–51, 1954. pdf eth zürich english translation 2016 peter sestoft c. böhm, "on family turing machines related programming language", icc bull., 3, 185–194, july 1964. introduced p′′, first imperative language without goto proved turing-complete. c. böhm, g. jacopini, "flow diagrams, turing machines languages two formation rules", comm. acm, 9(5): 366–371,1966. c. böhm, "alcune proprietà delle forme β-η-normali nel λ-k-calcolo", pubbl. inac, n. 696, roma, 1968. c. böhm, a. berarducci, "automatic synthesis typed lambda-programs term algebras", theoretical computer science, 39: 135–154, 1985. c. böhm, "functional programming combinatory algebras", mfcs, carlsbad, czechoslovakia, eds m.p. chytil, l. janiga v. koubek, lncs 324, 14–26, 1988. == see also == p′′, minimal computer programming language structured program theorem list pioneers computer science böhm tree böhm's theorem == references == vitae (university rome) == external links == corrado böhm mathematics genealogy project "a collection Name: Jeff Bonwick
Content: jeff bonwick invented led development zfs file system, used oracle corporation's zfs storage products well startups including nexenta, delphix, joyent, datto, inc. bonwick also inventor slab allocation, used many operating systems including macos linux, lzjb compression algorithm. roles included sun fellow, sun storage cto, oracle vice president. == history == 2010 bonwick co-founded small company called dssd mike shapiro bill moore, became chief technical officer. co-invented dssd's system hardware architecture software. developed dssd's whole-system simulator, enabled team explore possible hardware topologies software algorithms. dssd acquired emc corporation 2014, became part dell technologies 2016. end 2016, bill moore left company, bonwick remained cto. dssd product, called d5, cancelled march 2017. == lzjb == bonwick invented lzjb, lossless data compression algorithm compress crash dumps data zfs. software cddl license licensed. includes number improvements lzrw1 algorithm, member lempel–ziv family compression algorithms. name lzjb derived parent algorithm creator — lempel ziv jeff bonwick. == references ==

Content: kathleen hylda valerie booth (née britten, 9 july 1922 – 29 september 2022) british computer scientist mathematician wrote first assembly language designed assembler autocode first computer systems birkbeck college, university london. helped design three different machines including arc (automatic relay calculator), sec (simple electronic computer), ape(x)c. == early life education == kathleen britten born stourbridge, worcestershire, england, 9 july 1922. obtained bsc mathematics university london 1944 went get phd applied mathematics 1950. married colleague andrew donald booth
