co-authored "general considerations design purpose electronic digital computer," describing modifications original arc redesign arc2 using von neumann architecture. part contribution arc assembly language. also built maintained arc components. kathleen andrew booth's team birkbeck considered smallest early british computer groups. 1947 1953, produced three machines: arc (automatic relay computer) built xenia sweeting, sec (simple electronic computer), ape(x)c (all-purpose electronic (rayon) computer). mr. booth worked team. considered remarkable achievement due size group limited funds disposal. although ape(x)c eventually led hec series manufactured british tabulating machine company, small scale birkbeck group place front rank british computer activity. booth regularly published papers concerning work arc ape(x)c systems co-wrote "automatic digital calculators" (1953) illustrated 'planning coding' programming style. 1957, she, husband, j.c. jennings co-founded birkbeck college's department numerical automation, school computer science information systems, 1957. 1958, taught programming course. 1958, booth wrote one first books describing program ape(x)c computers. 1944 junior scientific officer royal aircraft establishment farnborough. 1946 1962, booth research scientist british rubber producers' research association ten years 1952 1962 research birkbeck college booth family moved canada became research fellow, lecturer associate professor university saskatchewan 1972. lakehead university canada became professor mathematics 1972 1978. Name: Jonathan Bowen
Content: jonathan p. bowen fbcs frsa (born 1956) british computer scientist emeritus professor london south bank university, headed centre applied formal methods. prof. bowen also chairman museophile limited adjunct professor southwest university chongqing, china. professor computer science birmingham city university, visiting professor pratt institute (new york city), university westminster king's college london, visiting academic university college london. == early life education == bowen born oxford, son humphry bowen, educated dragon school, bryanston school, prior matriculation university college, oxford (oxford university) received degree engineering science. == career == bowen later worked imperial college, london, oxford university computing laboratory (now oxford university department computer science), university reading, london south bank university. main research formal methods general z notation particular. chair z user group early 2000s 2011. 2002, bowen elected chair british computer society facs specialist group formal aspects computing science. 2005, bowen associate editor-in-chief journal innovations systems software engineering. also associate editor editorial board acm computing surveys journal, covering software engineering formal methods. 2008–9, associate praxis high integrity systems, working large industrial project using z notation. bowen's major interest area online museums. 1994, founded virtual library museums pages (vlmp), online museums directory soon adopted international council museums (icom). shortly after, also started virtual museum computing. 2002, founded museophile limited help museums, especially online, example discussion forums. also worked industry oxford instruments, marconi instruments, logica, silicon graphics, altran praxis. bowen elected fellow royal society encouragement arts, manufactures commerce (rsa) 2002 british computer society (bcs) 2004. liveryman worshipful company information Name: Stephen R. Bourne
Content: stephen richard "steve" bourne (born 7 january 1944) english computer scientist based united states career. well known author bourne shell (sh), foundation standard command-line interfaces unix. == biography == bourne bachelor science (bsc) degree mathematics king's college london, england. diploma computer science doctor philosophy (ph.d.) mathematics trinity college, cambridge. subsequently, worked algol 68 compiler university cambridge computer laboratory (see algol 68c). also worked camal, system algebraic manipulation used lunar theory calculations. university cambridge, bourne spent nine years bell labs seventh edition unix team. besides bourne shell, wrote adb debugger unix system, second book topic, intended general readers. bell labs, bourne worked senior engineering management positions silicon graphics, digital equipment corporation, sun microsystems, cisco systems. involved developing international standards programming informatics, member international federation information processing (ifip) ifip working group 2.1 algorithmic languages calculi, specified, maintains, supports programming languages algol 60 algol 68. 2000 2002 president association computing machinery (acm). work computing, bourne awarded acm's presidential award 2008 made fellow organization 2005. also fellow royal astronomical society. bourne chief technology officer icon venture partners, venture capital firm based menlo park, california 2014. also chairperson editorial advisory board acm queue, magazine helped found president acm. == references == == external links == lindsay, bruce (6 december 2004). "a conversation bruce lindsay" (interview). interviewed stephen r. bourne. acm queue.

Name: Harry Bouwman
Content: willem adriaan gerrit anton ("harry") bouwman (born tilburg, 1953) dutch information systems researcher, professor åbo akademi university, institute advanced management systems research, known work mobile services, business models business architecture. == biography == bouwman obtained political science vu university amsterdam 1979, phd radboud university nijmegen, faculty social science 1986, degree computer science open university netherlands 1992. bouwman started career assistant professor university amsterdam 1985. 1996 1998 senior consultant netherlands organisation applied scientific research, associate professor mass communication communication management university utrecht 1996 1999. since 1998 associate professor information communication technology delft university technology, faculty technology, policy management, since 2011 distinguished professor åbo akademi university. bouwman visiting professor syracuse university 2004 northwestern university 2009. == selected publications == bouwman, h., van den hooff, b., van de wijngaert, l., & van dijk, j. Name: Robert S. Boyer
Content: robert stephen boyer american retired professor computer science, mathematics, philosophy university texas austin. j strother moore invented boyer–moore string-search algorithm, particularly efficient string searching algorithm, 1977. moore also collaborated boyer–moore automated theorem prover, nqthm, 1992. following this, worked moore matt kaufmann another theorem prover called acl2. elected aaai fellow 1991. == publications == boyer published extensively, including following books: computational logic handbook, j s. moore. second edition. academic press, london, 1998. automated reasoning: essays honor woody bledsoe, editor. kluwer academic, dordrecht, netherlands, 1991. computational logic handbook, j s. moore. academic press, new york, 1988. correctness problem computer science, editor, j s. moore. academic press, london, 1981. computational logic, j s. moore. academic press, new york, 1979. == see also == boyer–moore majority vote algorithm qed manifesto == references == == external links == home page robert s. boyer. accessed february 18, 2016. university texas, college liberal arts honors retired faculty - 2008. accessed march 21, 2009. robert stephen boyer mathematics genealogy project

Name: Karlheinz Brandenburg
Content: karlheinz brandenburg (born 20 june 1954) german electrical engineer mathematician. together ernst eberlein, heinz gerhäuser (former institutes director fraunhofer iis), bernhard grill, jürgen herre harald popp (all fraunhofer iis), developed widespread mp3 method audio data compression. also known elementary work field audio coding, perception measurement, wave field synthesis psychoacoustics. brandenburg received numerous national international research awards, prizes honors work. since 2000 professor electronic media technology technical university ilmenau. brandenburg significantly involved founding fraunhofer institute digital media technology (idmt) currently serves director. brandenburg called "father mp3" format. == biography == brandenburg received dipl. ing. degree erlangen university electrical engineering (1980) well dipl. math. degree mathematics (1982). 1989, obtained phd friedrich-alexander university erlangen-nuremberg electrical engineering work digital audio coding perceptual measurement techniques. brandenburg's phd advisor professor dieter seitzer, expert psychoacoustics. early 1980s, seitzer pet project called "digital jukebox." envisioned system people could connect central server hear music demand isdn phone lines. bandwidth isdn order magnitude narrow transmission cd-quality digital audio. standard compact disc uses linear pulse code modulation (pcm) 16 bits per sample per channel, 44,100 samples per second. means takes 1.4 million bits encode single second stereo audio. send music isdn playback speed, seitzer would need compress file factor almost 12-to-1. seitzer applied patent pet project, application rejected grounds trying "impossible." seitzer assigned brandenburg task investigating feasibility 12-to-1 audio compression. first brandenburg thought patent examiner right, studied matter began realize needed degree compression might possible. research results dissertation basis mpeg-1 layer 3 (mp3), mpeg-2 advanced audio coding (aac) modern audio compression schemes. international group mpeg, led italian engineer leonardo chiariglione cselt (that promoted standard validated it), took mp3 international iso standard. 1989 1990 worked at&t bell laboratories murray hill, new jersey, u.s. aspec mpeg-1 layer 3. 1990, returned university erlangen-nuremberg, and, 1993, became head audio/multimedia department fraunhofer institute integrated circuits erlangen. since 2000, full professor institute media technology technical university ilmenau. addition, director fraunhofer institute digital media technology idmt ilmenau. brandenburg fellow audio engineering society (aes) along josh andreason, abraham white. also head aes standards committee working group sc-06-04 internet audio delivery systems. granted 27 us patents co-inventor; patents multiple inventors. == awards == 2023: smpte digital processing medal recognition fundamental contributions developing mpeg digital audio compression systems 2015: technology award eduard rhein foundation (together dr.-ing. bernhard grill prof. dr.-ing. jürgen herre) 2014: imtc leadership award contribution audio coding standardization mp3 format (together prof. dr.-ing. bernd edler) honorary phd degree polytechnic university valencia development dissemination modern techniques digital audio coding, perceptual measurement, psychoacoustics election internet hall fame innovator important role developing mp3 format impact development advance internet's reach internet society (isoc) aes board governors award recognition co-chairing 53rd aes international conference 2011 "distinguished heyser memorial lecturer" aes 130th convention aes board governors award recognition co-chairing aes 42nd international Name: Gilles Brassard
Content: gilles brassard, faculty member université de montréal, full professor since 1988 canada research chair since 2001. == education early life == brassard received ph.d. computer science cornell university 1979, working field cryptography john hopcroft advisor. == research == brassard best known fundamental work quantum cryptography, quantum teleportation, quantum entanglement distillation, quantum pseudo-telepathy, classical simulation quantum entanglement. concepts implemented laboratory. 1984, together charles h. bennett, invented bb84 protocol quantum cryptography. later extended work include cascade error correction protocol, performs efficient detection correction noise caused eavesdropping quantum cryptographic signals. == awards honours == brassard editor-in-chief journal cryptology 1991 1998. 2000, prix marie-victorin, highest scientific award government quebec. elected fellow international association cryptologic research 2006, first canadian honored. june 2010, awarded gerhard herzberg canada gold medal, canada's highest scientific honour. brassard elected fellow royal society canada royal society london (2013). nomination reads: gilles brassard one earliest pioneers quantum information science world. celebrated breakthroughs invention quantum cryptography quantum teleportation, universally recognized fundamental cornerstones entire discipline. influential discoveries include privacy amplification, entanglement distillation, amplitude amplification first lower bound power quantum computers. visionary thinking groundbreaking research, professor brassard played pivotal role transforming field quantum information science initially perceived merely fringe pursuit area vigorous dynamic international activity. december 30, 2013, governor-general canada, right honourable david johnston, announced gilles brassard named officer order canada. 2018, received wolf prize physics 2019 bbva foundation frontiers knowledge award basic sciences. well micius quantum prize. september 2022, brassard awarded breakthrough prize fundamental physics, world’s largest science prize. 2023 awarded eduard rhein foundation prize technology. == references ==

Name: Lawrence M. Breed
Content: lawrence moser "larry" breed (july 17, 1940 – may 16, 2021) computer scientist, artist inventor, best known involvement programming language apl. == career == undergraduate stanford university 1961, created first computer animation language system used stanford football half-times coordinate images produced 100 ft-by-100 ft array rooters holding colored cards. graduate student stanford, corresponded apl's inventor, ken iverson, correct formal description ibm system/360 used iverson's notation. received m.s. stanford 1965, academic supervisor niklaus wirth. joined iverson's group ibm's thomas j. watson research center yorktown heights, new york. 1965 philip s. abrams created first implementation apl, written fortran ibm 7090. later created apl implementations experimental ibm little computer, ibm 360 1966, ibm 1130. breed 1973 recipient (with dick lathwell roger moore) grace murray hopper award association computing machinery "for work design implementation apl\360, setting new standards simplicity, efficiency, reliability response time interactive systems." dan dyer others co-founded scientific time sharing corporation 1969, led development apl plus time-sharing system. there, 1972, francis bates iii wrote one world's first worldwide email systems, named mailbox. breed rejoined ibm 1977. helped develop international organization standardization (iso) apl standard, joined ibm efforts port berkeley software distribution (bsd) unix onto ibm platforms. worked compilers programming language c, floating-point arithmetic standardization, radix conversion, retiring 1992. == retirement == breed became significant contributor burning man event, playa name ember. coined term "moop" (matter place), conceived built first trash fence capture windborne debris. created spiraling, flaming sculpture "chaotick", playa’s longest-running art piece besides man himself, built artistic bicycle light effects. edited proofread black rock gazette newspaper, role continued co-founder director successor black rock beacon, edited burning man materials. co-founder earth guardians, breed promoted "leave trace" ethos, particularly post-event cleanup. 1973 1974 took first place, co-solver donna breed, dictionary rally. == gray-b-gone evapotrons == associated burning man activities, breed devised gray-b-gon evapotron evaporators graywater disposal, bay area workshops directed construction, burning man campers, 100 units, 2012. == publications == — (august 1970). "the apl plus file system". proceedings share. vol. 35. p. 392. oclc 554296375. — (july 1971). "generalizing apl scalar extension". acm sigplan notices. 6 (5): 12–14. doi:10.1145/1115904.1115906. s2cid 40788922. "evapotrons". archived original july 16, 2017. == references ==

Name: Sergey Brin
Content: sergey mikhailovich brin (russian: сергей михайлович брин; born august 21, 1973) american businessman computer scientist known co-founding google larry page. president google's parent company, alphabet inc., stepping role december 3, 2019. page remain alphabet co-founders, controlling shareholders, board members. june 2024, brin 7th-richest person world, estimated net worth $146 billion, according bloomberg billionaires index forbes. brin immigrated united states soviet union age six. earned bachelor's degree university maryland, college park, following father's grandfather's footsteps studying mathematics well computer science. graduation, enrolled stanford university acquire phd computer science. met page, built web search engine. program became popular stanford, discontinued phd studies start google susan wojcicki's garage menlo park. == early life education == sergey mikhailovich brin born august 21, 1973, moscow soviet union, russian jewish parents, mikhail eugenia brin, graduates moscow state university (msu). father retired mathematics professor university maryland, mother researcher nasa's goddard space flight center. brin family lived three-room apartment central moscow, also shared sergey's paternal grandmother. 1977, father returned mathematics conference warsaw, poland, mikhail brin announced time family emigrate. formally applied exit visa september 1978, result, father "promptly fired". related reasons, mother leave job. next eight months, without steady income, forced take temporary jobs waited, afraid request would denied many refuseniks. may 1979, granted official exit visas allowed leave country. brin family lived vienna paris mikhail brin secured teaching position university maryland help anatole katok. time, brin family received support assistance hebrew immigrant aid society. arrived united states october 25, 1979. brin attended elementary school paint branch montessori school adelphi, maryland, received education home; father, professor department mathematics university maryland, encouraged learn mathematics family helped retain russian-language skills. attended eleanor roosevelt high school, maryland. september 1990, brin enrolled university maryland, received bachelor science department computer science 1993 honors computer science mathematics age 19. 1993, interned wolfram research, developers mathematica. brin began graduate study computer science stanford university graduate fellowship national science foundation, receiving m.s. computer science 1995. 2008, leave phd studies stanford. == search engine development == orientation new students stanford, met larry page. two men seemed disagree subjects, spending time together "became intellectual soul-mates close friends." brin's focus developing data mining systems page's extending "the concept inferring importance research paper citations papers". together, authored paper titled "the anatomy large-scale hypertextual web search engine". convert backlink data gathered backrub's web crawler measure importance given web page, brin page developed pagerank algorithm, realized could used build search engine far superior existing time. new algorithm relied new kind technology analyzed relevance backlinks connected one web page another, allowed number links rank, determine rank page. combining ideas, began utilizing page's dormitory room machine laboratory, extracted spare parts inexpensive computers create device used connect nascent search engine stanford's broadband campus network. filling page's room equipment, converted brin's dorm room office programming center, tested new search engine designs web. rapid growth project caused stanford's computing infrastructure experience problems. page brin used former's basic html programming skills set simple search page users, web page developer create anything visually elaborate. also began using computer part could find assemble necessary computing power handle searches multiple users. search engine grew popularity among stanford users, required additional servers process queries. august 1996, initial version google made available stanford web site. early 1997, backrub page described state follows: rough statistics (from august 29, 1996) total indexable html urls: 75.2306 million total content downloaded: 207.022 gigabytes ... backrub written java python runs several sun ultras intel pentiums running linux. primary database kept sun ultra series ii 28gb disk. scott hassan alan steremberg provided great deal talented implementation help. sergey brin also involved deserves many thanks. - larry page pagecs.stanford.edu backrub already exhibited rudimentary functions characteristics search engine: query input entered provided list backlinks ranked importance. page recalled: "we realized querying tool. gave good overall ranking pages ordering follow-up pages." page said mid-1998 finally realized potential project: "pretty soon, 10,000 searches day. figured, maybe really real." compared page brin's vision impact johannes gutenberg, inventor modern printing: 1440, johannes gutenberg introduced europe mechanical printing press, printing bibles mass consumption. technology allowed books manuscripts‍—‌originally replicated hand‍—‌to printed much faster rate, thus spreading knowledge helping usher european renaissance ... google done similar job. comparison also noted authors google story: "not since gutenberg ... new invention empowered individuals, transformed access information, profoundly google." also, long two "cooked new engine web searches, began thinking information time beyond web," digitizing books expanding health information. == interests == june 2008, brin invested $4.5 million space adventures, virginia-based space tourism company. brin page jointly customized boeing 767–200 dassault/dornier alpha jet, pay $1.3 million year house two gulfstream v jets owned google executives moffett federal airfield. aircraft scientific equipment installed nasa allow experimental data collected flight. brin backer lta research & exploration llc, airship maker company. october 2023, lta's 124-meter long flagship, pathfinder 1, became largest airship since hindenburg receive clearance flight testing, permitted boundaries moffett field neighboring palo alto airport’s airspaces, height 460 meters. == personal life == brin raised jewish, religious. may 2007, brin married biotech analyst entrepreneur anne wojcicki bahamas. son late 2008 daughter late 2011. august 2013, announced brin wife living separately brin extramarital affair google glass's marketing director amanda rosenberg. june 2015, brin wojcicki finalized divorce. november 7, 2018, married nicole shanahan, legal tech founder. daughter, born late 2018. brin shanahan separated december 15, 2021, brin filed divorce january 4, 2022. summer 2023, divorce finalized. brin's mother, eugenia, diagnosed parkinson's disease. 2008, decided make donation university maryland school medicine, mother received treatment. according forbes, brin donated $1 billion fund research disease. brin wojcicki, although divorced, jointly ran brin wojcicki foundation 2014. since then, brin used sergey brin family foundation donor-advised fund philanthropic giving. donated extensively michael j. fox foundation 2009 gave $1 million support hebrew immigrant aid society. brin donor democratic party candidates organizations, donated $5,000 barack obama's reelection campaign $30,800 dnc. == awards accolades == === 2002–2009 === 2002, brin, along larry page, named mit technology review tr100, one top 100 innovators world age 35. 2003, brin page received honorary mba ie business school "for embodying entrepreneurial spirit lending momentum creation new businesses...". 2003, brin page award recipients national finalists ey entrepreneur year award 2004, received marconi foundation prize, "highest award engineering", elected fellows marconi foundation columbia university. "in announcing selection, john jay iselin, foundation's president, congratulated two men invention fundamentally changed way information retrieved today." 2004, brin received american academy achievement's golden plate award larry page ceremony chicago, illinois. 2006, inaugural class winner great immigrants award named carnegie corporation new york === 2009–present === november 2009, forbes named brin page fifth powerful people world. earlier year, february, brin inducted national academy engineering, "among highest professional distinctions accorded engineer ... [and] honors made outstanding contributions engineering research, practice...". selected specifically, "for leadership development rapid indexing retrieval relevant information world wide web". Name: Per Brinch Hansen
Content: per brinch hansen (13 november 1938 – 31 july 2007) danish-american computer scientist known work operating systems, concurrent programming parallel distributed computing. == biography == === early life education === per brinch hansen born frederiksberg, enclave surrounded copenhagen, denmark. father, jørgen brinch hansen, worked civil engineer, becoming leading expert soil mechanics, contributions." seven-week student internship ibm's hursley laboratory england, decided dedicate career computers. initially focused computer construction, reading book ibm 7030 stretch project described computer organization programmer's point view refocused interest toward becoming computer architect. === regnecentralen === completing master science degree electronic engineering 1963, brinch hansen landed job regnecentralen, research institution danish academy technical sciences (akademiet de tekniske videnskaber), working compiler group, led peter naur jørn jensen. there, first significant project writing parser cobol compiler siemens 3003 computer. subsequently, wrote file system used execution compiled cobol programs, later observing: understand really small operating system, programmed. however, mid 1960s, dividing line language implementation operating systems still clearly understood. 1966, brinch hansen moved henning isaksson's hardware group regnecentralen, company shareholders. together peter kraft, defined computer architecture instruction set regnecentralen's third computer, rc 4000, using algol 60 hardware description language produce formal specification. inexperienced multiprogramming, used copy cooperating sequential processes edsger dijkstra sent understand process synchronization using semaphores, implemented specialized rc 4000 real-time monitor use managing fertilizer plant. peter kraft charles simonyi, still teenager, wrote p-code interpreter data logging task programs compiled p-code. summer 1967, brinch hansen left regnecentralen's hardware group become head rc 4000 software development, led team including jørn jensen, peter kraft søren lauesen defining general-purpose rc 4000 multiprogramming system, goal avoid developing custom real-time control operating system every rc 4000 installation, support batch processing time-sharing well. resulting system complete operating system, small kernel providing mechanisms upon operating systems different purposes could built. spring 1969, well-documented, reliable version rc 4000 multiprogramming system running. === carnegie mellon university === late 1970, brinch hansen moved pittsburgh, accepting invitation alan perlis visit department computer science carnegie mellon university research associate, wrote first systematic textbook operating system principles. time, 1971 summer school marktoberdorf symposium belfast, brinch hansen, tony hoare dijkstra began discuss ideas evolved monitor concept. spring 1972, reading class concept invented ole-johan dahl kristen nygaard simula 67, brinch hansen completed text chapter resource protection proposed first monitor notation, using shared classes. 1973, operating system principles published, becoming first comprehensive textbook operating systems. === california institute technology === july 1972, brinch hansen joined faculty california institute technology (caltech) associate professor computer science, began work defining programming language concurrent processes monitors. april 1974, distributed technical report concurrent pascal. concurrent pascal compiler pdp 11/45, written brinch hansen's doctoral student, al hartmann, released january 1975. subsequently, brinch hansen began writing model operating systems concurrent pascal, evaluate language. may 1975, completed solo, single-user operating system development concurrent pascal programs. next, rewrote original rc 4000 real-time scheduler concurrent pascal, taking three days write it, three hours machine time systematically test it. caltech computer science department shifted focus toward computer engineering away programming brinch hansen decided leave, rather seek tenure there. === university southern california === 1976, brinch hansen chose university southern california (usc) next post, family could remain altadena home. joining faculty tenured full professor, first chair newly created computer science department, led efforts identify attract top-notch faculty build first rate department. 1980, usc's computer science department ranked national research council one top ten us. usc, brinch hansen wrote second book, architecture concurrent programs, based work developing operating systems concurrent pascal. published 1977, first book concurrent programming. 1978, brinch hansen became first computer scientist awarded doctor technices degree, highest academic distinction within engineering technological science denmark, work documented architecture concurrent programs. later 1978, brinch hansen published distributed processes language concept, proposing use remote procedure calls synchronize processes running across microcomputer network. also 1978, l. j. sevins steve goings mostek visited brinch hansen usc, outlined low-cost multiprocessor architecture. mostek began project implement multiprocessor, brinch hansen working consultant. brinch hansen developed new concurrent programming language, edison, project. rc 4000 project, edison also used formal specification language hardware. mostek got initial 4-node multiprocessor working brinch hansen wrote portable edison compiler pdp 11/55, shortly after, united technologies acquired mostek cancelled project. 1982, brinch hansen moved edison system ibm personal computer (pc), published third book, programming personal computer. 1982, brinch hansen named first henry salvatori professor computer science usc. === university copenhagen === 1984, feeling homesick denmark 14 years abroad, brinch hansen left usc joined faculty university copenhagen professor datalogy. 1985, elected fellow institute electrical electronics engineers (ieee). later 1985, fourth book brinch hansen pascal compilers, used compiler course, published. designing multicomputer operating system danish company gn elmi, brinch hansen concluded needed new language, time leveraging message passing paradigm hoare's csp. resulting language, joyce, removed major limitation csp introducing parallel recursion. brinch hansen developed portable implementation ibm pc. === syracuse university === finding neither family felt home denmark, brinch hansen decided return us, discovered immigration status required quickly. brinch hansen contacted john reynolds syracuse university 1987 joined faculty distinguished professor. working student rangachari anand, joyce moved encore multimax 320 multiprocessor su's northeast parallel architectures center. recognizing scaling limitations multiprocessors, however, brinch hansen sought suitable multicomputer work. acquiring meiko computing surface 1989, began experimenting scientific applications developing parallel programs householder's method (reduction) n-body simulation learning exercises, surprised find programs nearly identical control structures. concluding fit "all-pairs paradigm," focused exploring reusable parallel algorithm structures termed "programming paradigms" "generic programs" (later, popularly known "design patterns"). 1995, brinch hansen's fifth book, studies computational science: parallel programming paradigms published, programs rewritten superpascal, fully implemented publication language created parallel algorithms. === last years === later years, brinch hansen published retrospective important papers, search simplicity (1996), text course programming non-majors, programming everyone java (1999), retrospective evolution operating systems, classic operating systems: batch processing distributed systems (2001), retrospective hansen awarded ieee computer pioneer award "for pioneering development operating systems concurrent programming exemplified work rc 4000 multiprogramming system, monitors, concurrent pascal." july 31, 2007, brinch hansen died, shortly diagnosed terminal cancer. == personal life == brinch hansen met wife milena (née hrastar) class trip yugoslavia 1962. married 1965 two children, daughter mette son thomas. == scientific contributions influence == career spanning five decades, brinch hansen made seminal contributions areas operating systems, concurrent computing parallel distributed computing influential shaping development fields advancing ad hoc techniques systematic engineering disciplines. influence work amplified "relentless search simplicity," insistence clarity, writing rewriting papers many times publishing them, becoming "one best explainers business," commitment testing concepts working systems – brinch hansen implemented distributed working systems new concepts developed, noting: uncommon computer scientist make proposal without testing whether good practice. spending 3 days writing monitor proposal 3 years implementing it, well understand temptation. perhaps also Name: Sjaak Brinkkemper
Content: jacobus nicolaas (sjaak) brinkkemper (born monnickendam, 18 january 1958) dutch computer scientist, full professor organisation information department information computing sciences utrecht university. == biography == brinkkemper received ba university amsterdam 1980 msc radboud university nijmegen 1984, mathematics. 1990 received phd university thesis formalisation information systems modelling, supervised eckhard falkenberg alex verrijn stuart. 1984 became assistant professor department informatics radboud university. 1992 became associate professor university twente. addition, process architect baan 1996 2002 consultant emendas another year. since 2004 brinkkemper full professor utrecht university, leads group twenty researchers specialized product software development entrepreneurship. member editorial boards journals business informatics, european journal information systems, journal database management, journal information systems e-business management, management information systems quarterly. since 1989 member international federation information processing ifip wg 8.1 working group information systems design evaluation. == work == brinkkemper's research interests methodology product software development, software implementation, methods, requirements management, method engineering, information systems methodology, case-tools, system development tools. == publications == brinkkemper published several books, papers, articles. books: sjaak brinkkemper. formalisation information systems modelling. phd thesis radboud university, Name: Fred Brooks
Content: frederick phillips brooks jr. (april 19, 1931 – november 17, 2022) american computer architect, software engineer, computer scientist, best known managing development ibm's system/360 family computers os/360 software support package, later writing candidly experiences seminal book mythical man-month. 1976, brooks elected national academy engineering "contributions computer system design development academic programs computer sciences". brooks received many awards, including national medal technology 1985 turing award 1999. == education == born april 19, 1931, durham, north carolina, attended duke university, graduating 1953 bachelor science degree physics, received ph.d. applied mathematics (computer science) harvard university 1956, supervised howard aiken. brooks served graduate teaching assistant ken iverson harvard's graduate program "automatic data processing", first program world. == career research == brooks joined ibm 1956, working poughkeepsie, new york, yorktown, new york. worked architecture ibm 7030 stretch, $10 million scientific supercomputer nine sold, ibm 7950 harvest computer national security agency. subsequently, became manager development ibm system/360 family computers os/360 software package. time coined term "computer architecture". 1964, brooks accepted invitation come university north carolina chapel hill founded university's computer science department. chaired 20 years. 2013 still engaged active research there, primarily virtual environments scientific visualization. years leaving ibm, wrote mythical man-month. seed book planted ibm's then-ceo thomas j. watson jr., asked brooks's exit interview much harder manage software projects hardware projects. book, brooks made now-famous statement: "adding manpower late software project makes later", since come known brooks's law. addition mythical man-month, brooks also known paper "no silver bullet – essence accident software engineering". 2004 talk computer history museum also 2010 interview wired magazine, brooks asked "what consider greatest technological achievement?" brooks responded, "the important single decision ever made change ibm 360 series 6-bit byte 8-bit byte, thereby enabling use lowercase letters. change propagated everywhere." "20th anniversary" edition mythical man-month four additional chapters published 1995. well mythical man-month, brooks authored co-authored many books peer reviewed papers including automatic data processing, "no silver bullet", computer architecture, design design. contributions human–computer interaction described ben shneiderman's hci pioneers website. === service memberships === brooks served number us national boards committees, including: defense science board (1983–86) member, artificial intelligence task force (1983–84) chairman, military software task force (1985–87) member, computers simulation training task force (1986–87) national science board (1987–92) === awards honors === chronological order: january 2005, gave turing lecture subject "collaboration telecollaboration design". == personal life == brooks evangelical christian active intervarsity christian fellowship. brooks married nancy lee greenwood 1956. three children. named eldest son kenneth e. iverson. brooks died november 17, 2022, age 91. poor health following stroke. == references == == external links == media related fred brooks wikimedia commons quotations related fred brooks wikiquote

Name: Rod Burstall
Content: rodney martineau "rod" burstall (born 1934) fellow royal society edinburgh (frse) british computer scientist one four founders laboratory foundations computer science university edinburgh. == biography == burstall studied physics university cambridge, m.sc. operational research university birmingham. worked three years returning birmingham university earn ph.d. 1966 thesis titled heuristic decision tree methods computers: operational research applications supervision n. a. dudley k. b. haley. burstall early influential proponent functional programming, pattern matching, list comprehension, known work robin popplestone cowsel (renamed pop-1) pop-2, innovative programming languages developed university edinburgh around 1970, later work john darlington npl program transformation david macqueen sannella hope, precursor standard ml, miranda, haskell. 1995, elected fellow royal society edinburgh. burstall retired 2000, becoming professor emeritus. 2002 david rydeheard sannella assembled festschrift burstall published formal aspects computing. 2009, awarded association computing machinery (acm) sigplan programming language achievement award. == books == may 1971: programming pop-11, edinburgh university press. 1980: (with alan bundy) artificial intelligence: introductory course, edinburgh university press. 1988: (with d. e. rydeheard) computational category theory, prentice-hall, isbn 978-0131627369. == references == == external links == university edinburgh home page (archived) rod burstall home page (archived) rod m. burstall dblp bibliography server

Name: Rod Canion
Content: joseph rodney "rod" canion (born january 19, 1945) american computer scientist businessman co-founded compaq computer corporation 1982 served first president ceo. == biography == native houston, canion graduated university houston 1966 1968 bachelor's master's degrees electrical engineering emphasis computer science. co-founding compaq 1982, canion, jim harris bill murto senior managers texas instruments. === compaq === three co-founders received backing venture capitalist benjamin m. rosen, became chairman board compaq. canion's tenure compaq's ceo, company set records highest first-year sales history american business reached fortune 500 $1 billion revenue faster company. soft-spoken canion popular employees culture built helped compaq attract best talent. instead headquartering company downtown houston skyscraper, canion chose west coast-style campus surrounded forests, every employee similar offices no-one (not even ceo) reserved parking spot. semi-annual meetings, turnout high employee could ask questions senior managers. canion shy, took lessons polish speaking style rosen's request. 1991, compaq suffered first loss company, canion dismissed rosen succeeded ceo eckhard pfeiffer, then-coo former president compaq international. rosen initiated 14-hour board meeting, directors also interviewed pfeiffer several hours without informing canion. conclusion, board unanimous picking pfeiffer canion. canion popular company workers, 150 employees staged impromptu protest signs stating "we love you, rod." taking newspaper ad saying "rod, wind beneath wings. love you." canion declined offer remain compaq's board bitter ouster speak rosen years, although relationship became cordial again. 1999, canion admitted ouster justified, saying "i burned out. needed leave. [rosen] felt strong sense urgency". two weeks canion's ouster, five senior executives resigned, including remaining company founder james harris svp engineering. departures motivated enhanced severance early retirement, well imminent demotion functions shifted vice presidents. === leaving compaq === 1992, canion founded insource technology group jim harris ronald l. fischer served chairman september 2006. 1999, led initial investment round questia media, inc., provided online research library closure 2020. canion became chairman board later helped company raise $150 million. member board directors amvescap, bluearc, young life, healthlink, director emeritus houston technology center, member board advisors sternhill partners. november 12, 2012, canion along compaq co-founders harris murto organized compaq 30th anniversary reunion minute maid park compaq alumni group. [2] 2013, canion published memoir career compaq, ibm pc compatible industry began compaq portable eventually outgrew ibm, canion created extended industry standard architecture bus along "the gang nine" 1988. 2016, documentary film "silicon cowboys" also based story compaq. == references == == external links == silicon cowboys (2016) – documentary open book archived 2017-07-29 wayback machine – compaq ended ibm's pc domination helped invent modern computing book compaq alumni group

Name: Gregory Chaitin
Content: gregory john chaitin ( chy-tin; born 25 june 1947) argentine-american mathematician computer scientist. beginning late 1960s, chaitin made contributions algorithmic information theory metamathematics, particular computer-theoretic result equivalent gödel's incompleteness theorem. considered one founders today known algorithmic (solomonoff–kolmogorov–chaitin, kolmogorov program-size) complexity together andrei kolmogorov ray solomonoff. along works e.g. solomonoff, kolmogorov, martin-löf, leonid levin, algorithmic information theory became foundational part theoretical computer science, information theory, mathematical logic. common subject several computer science curricula. besides computer scientists, chaitin's work draws attention many philosophers mathematicians fundamental problems mathematical creativity digital philosophy. == mathematics computer science == gregory chaitin jewish attended bronx high school science city college new york, (still teens) developed theory led independent discovery algorithmic complexity. chaitin defined chaitin's constant ω, real number whose digits equidistributed sometimes informally described expression probability random program halt. ω mathematical property definable, asymptotic approximations (but above), computable. chaitin also originator using graph coloring register allocation compiling, process known chaitin's algorithm. formerly researcher ibm's thomas j. watson research center new york. written 10 books translated 15 languages. today interested questions metabiology information-theoretic formalizations theory evolution, member institute advanced studies mohammed vi polytechnic university. == scholarly contributions == chaitin also writes philosophy, especially metaphysics philosophy mathematics (particularly epistemological matters mathematics). metaphysics, chaitin claims algorithmic information theory key solving problems field biology (obtaining formal definition 'life', origin evolution) neuroscience (the problem consciousness study mind). recent writings, defends position known digital philosophy. epistemology mathematics, claims findings mathematical logic algorithmic information theory show "mathematical facts true reason, true accident". chaitin proposes mathematicians must abandon hope proving mathematical facts adopt quasi-empirical methodology. == honors == 1995 given degree doctor science honoris causa university maine. 2002 given title honorary professor university buenos aires argentina, parents born chaitin spent part youth. 2007 given leibniz medal wolfram research. 2009 given degree doctor philosophy honoris causa national university córdoba. formerly researcher ibm's thomas j. watson research center professor federal university rio de janeiro. == criticism == philosophers logicians disagree philosophical conclusions chaitin drawn theorems related chaitin thinks kind fundamental arithmetic randomness. logician torkel franzén criticized chaitin's interpretation gödel's incompleteness theorem alleged explanation chaitin's work represents. == bibliography == information, randomness & incompleteness (world scientific 1987) (online) algorithmic information theory (cambridge university press 1987) (online) information-theoretic incompleteness (world scientific 1992) (online) limits mathematics (springer-verlag 1998) (online) unknowable (springer-verlag 1999) (online) exploring randomness (springer-verlag 2001) (online) conversations mathematician (springer-verlag 2002) (online) philosophy program size (tallinn cybernetics institute 2003) meta math!: quest omega (pantheon books 2005) (reprinted uk meta maths: quest omega, atlantic books 2006) (arxiv:math/0404335) teoria algoritmica della complessità (g. giappichelli editore 2006) thinking gödel & turing (world scientific 2007) (online) mathematics, complexity philosophy (editorial midas 2011) gödel's way (crc press 2012) proving darwin: making biology mathematical (pantheon books 2012) (online) building world information & computation (academia.edu 2023) (online) philosophical mathematics: infinity, incompleteness, irreducibility (academia.edu 2023) (online) == references == == reading == pagallo, ugo (2005), introduzione alla filosofia digitale. da leibniz chaitin [introduction digital Name: Robert Cailliau
Content: robert cailliau (last name pronunciation: [kajo], born 26 january 1947) belgian informatics engineer proposed first (pre-www) hypertext system cern 1987 collaborated tim berners-lee world wide web (jointly winning acm software system award) got name. designed historical logo www, organized first international world wide web conference cern 1994 helped transfer web development cern global web consortium 1995. listed co-author web born james gillies, first book-length account origins world wide web. == biography == cailliau born tongeren, belgium. 1958 moved parents antwerp. secondary school graduated ghent university 1969 civil, mechanical electrical engineering (dutch: burgerlijk werktuigkundig en elektrotechnisch ingenieur). also msc university michigan computer, information control engineering, 1972. military service belgian army, maintained fortran programs simulate troop movements. december 1974 started working cern fellow proton synchrotron (ps) division, participating renovation project control system accelerator. april 1987 left ps division become group leader office computing systems data handling division. 1989, tim berners-lee proposed hypertext system access many forms documentation related cern. berners-lee created system, calling world wide web, september december 1990. time, cailliau co-authored proposal funding activity. cailliau later became key proponent cern's web activity, running several student projects create support browsers different operating systems including various unix flavours classic mac os. nicola pellow helped develop first web browser classic mac os operating system called macwww. 1993, collaboration fraunhofer-gesellschaft cailliau started european commission's first web-based project information dissemination europe (wise). result work cern's legal service, cern's director future research walter hoogland signed official document released web technology public domain 30 april 1993. december 1993 cailliau called first international www conference held cern may 1994. oversubscribed conference brought together 380 web pioneers milestone development web. conference led forming international world wide web conferences steering committee organized annual conference since then. cailliau founding member committee 1994 2002. 1995 cailliau started "web schools" project european commission, introducing web resource education. helping transfer web development cern world wide web consortium (w3c), devoted time public communication. went retirement cern january 2007. cailliau active member newropeans, pan-european political movement luca cominassi drafted proposal concerning european information society. public speaker past future world wide web delivered many keynote speeches international conferences. currently status external collaborator cern ideasquare. == awards == 1995: acm software system award (with tim berners-lee) 1999: christophe plantin prize, antwerp 1999: dr. hon. southern cross university 2000: dr. hon. university ghent 2001: médaille genève reconnaissante (with tim berners-lee) 2004: commander order king leopold (awarded king albert ii belgium) 2006: honorary citizenship city tongeren 2008: gold medal flemish academy sciences arts 2009: dr. hon. university liège (with tim berners-lee) 2010: ehrenpreis best swiss web 2012: internet hall fame internet society 2021: dr. hon. university michigan co-creation (as cited acm 1995 award cailliau) world-wide-web 2023: honorary member alumni society engineers ghent university == see also == history world wide web == bibliography == web born (oxford university press) publications dblp computer science library == references == == external links == first international conference world-wide web first international conference world-wide web announcement international world wide web conference committee interview cailliau 1997 ideasquare

Name: Zhou Chaochen
Content: zhou chaochen (chinese: 周巢尘; born 1 november 1937) chinese computer scientist. zhou born nanhui, shanghai, china. studied undergraduate department mathematics mechanics, peking university (1954–1958) postgraduate institute computing technology, chinese academy sciences (cas) (1963–1967). worked peking university cas visit oxford university computing laboratory (now oxford university department computer science) (1989–1992). time, prime investigator duration calculus, interval logic real-time systems part european esprit procos project provably correct systems. periods 1990–1992 1995–1996, zhou chaochen visiting professor department computer science, technical university denmark, lyngby, invitation professor dines bjørner. principal research fellow (1992–1997) later director unu-iist macau (1997–2002), retirement, returned beijing. 2007, zhou dines bjørner, first director unu-iist, honoured occasion 70th birthdays. zhou member chinese academy sciences. == books == zhou, chaochen hansen, michael r., duration calculus: formal approach real-time systems. springer-verlag, monographs theoretical computer science, eatcs series, 2003. isbn 3-540-40823-1. == references == == external links == institute software, chinese academy sciences (iscas) information chaochen zhou dblp bibliography server

Name: Peter Chen
Content: peter pin-shan chen (chinese: 陳品山; born 3 january 1947) taiwanese american computer scientist. (retired) distinguished career scientist faculty member carnegie mellon university distinguished chair professor emeritus lsu. known development entity–relationship model 1976. == biography == born 1947 taichung, taiwan, peter chen received b.s. electrical engineering 1968 national taiwan university, ph.d. computer science/applied mathematics harvard university 1973. 1970, worked one summer ibm. graduating harvard, spent one year honeywell summer digital equipment corporation. 1974 1978 chen assistant professor mit sloan school management. 1978 1983 associate professor university california, los angeles (ucla management school). 1983 2011 chen held position m. j. foster distinguished chair professor computer science louisiana state university and, several years, adjunct professor business school medical school (shreveport). period, visiting professor harvard '89-'90 three times massachusetts institute technology (eecs dept. '86-'87, sloan school '90-'91, division engineering systems 06-'07). 2010 2020, chen distinguished career scientist faculty member carnegie mellon university, u.s.a. besides lecturing around world, also served (honorary) professor outside u.s. 1984, sponsorship united nations, taught one-month short course databases huazhong university science technology wuhan, china, awarded honorary professor there. then, went beijing member ieee delegation first international conference computers applications (the first major ieee computer conference held china). 2008 2014, honorary chair professor institute service science national tsing hua university, taiwan. starting 2016, honorary chair professor department bioengineering bioinformatics, asia university (taiwan). chen served advisor government agencies corporations. member advisory board computer information science engineering directorate national science foundation (2004-2006) united states air force scientific advisory board (2005-2009). == awards honors == chen's original paper one influential papers computer software field based survey 1,000 computer science professors documented book "great papers computer science". chen's work also cited book software challenges published time-life books 1993 series "understanding computers." chen recognized one pioneers book "software pioneers". listed who's america who's world. chen received many awards fields information technology. received data resource management technology award data administration management association (dama international) new york city 1990. elected fellow association computing machinery (acm), american association advancement science (aaas), ieee, er. achievement award information management 2000 dama international. inductee data management hall fame 2000. received stevens award software method innovation 2001. 2003, chen received ieee harry h. goode memorial award ieee-cs board governors meeting san diego. presented acm - aaai allen newell award acm banquet san diego june 2003 international joint conference artificial intelligence (ijcai) acapulco august 2003. chen also recipient pan wen-yuan outstanding research award 2004. june 2011 jeju island, korea, chen received transformative achievement medal software engineering society society design process science. 2021, received leadership award ieee technical committee service computing (tcsvc). innovative work initiated/accelerated new field research practice called "conceptual modeling" based conceptual model (computer science) entity–relationship model. 1979, founded annual international professional meeting, international conference conceptual modeling, held different countries. also founded data & knowledge engineering journal publishing disseminating scholarly research results. == peter p. chen award == recognize chen's pioneering leadership role, "peter p. chen award" established 2008, honor excellent researchers/educators outstanding contributions field conceptual modeling year. recipients peter p. chen award are: 2008: bernhard thalheim, professor, university kiel, germany 2009: david w. embley, professor, brigham young university (byu), u.s.a. 2010: john mylopoulos, professor, university toronto, canada, university trento, italy 2011: tok wang ling, professor, national university singapore (nus), singapore 2012: stefano spaccapietra, honorary professor, swiss federal institute technology (epfl), switzerland 2013: carlo batini, professor, university milano-bicocca, italy 2014: antonio l. furtado, professor, puc-rio, brazil 2015: il-yeol song, professor, drexel university, u.s.a. 2016: óscar pastor, professor, universitat politècnica de valència, spain 2017: yair wand, canfor professor mis, university british columbia, canada 2018: veda c. storey, tull professor computer information systems, georgia state university, atlanta, u.s.a. 2019: eric yu, professor, university toronto, canada. 2020: matthias jarke, professor, rwth aachen university, germany chairman, fraunhofer ict group. 2021: sudha ram, anheuser-busch professor mis, entrepreneurship innovation, university arizona, u.s.a. 2022: maurizio lenzerini, professor computer science engineering, sapienza university rome, italy. 2023: nicola guarino, head laboratory applied ontology (loa), part italian national research council (cnr) trento, italy. == peter chen big data young researcher award == recognize chen's pioneering role contributions building foundation big data modeling analysis, "peter chen big data young researcher award" established 2015 service society steering committee eight co-located ieee conferences (ieee icws/scc/cloud/ms/bigdatacongress/services), honor promising young big data researcher year ieee big data congress co-located conferences, starting ieee bigdata 2015 congress. peter chen big data young researcher award winners are: 2015: yi chen, associate professor, new jersey institute technology, u.s.a. 2016: wei tan, research staff member, ibm thomas j. watson research center, yorktown heights, ny usa. 2017: ilkay altintas, chief data science officer, san diego supercomputer center, univ. california, san diego, usa. == work == === entity–relationship modeling conceptual data modeling === entity–relationship model serves foundation many systems analysis design methodologies, computer-aided software engineering (case) tools, repository systems. er model basis ibm's repository manager/mvs dec's cdd/plus. chen's original paper commonly cited definitive reference entity relationship modeling though concept object relationship developed year earlier schmid swenson reported 1975 acm sigmod proceedings [1]. chen one pioneers using entity–relationship concepts software information system modeling design. chen's paper, basic entity–relationship ideas used mostly informally practitioners. chen first published abstract presented er model first large database conference september 1975, year paper similar concepts written a. p. g. brown. chen's main contributions formalizing concepts, developing theory set data definition manipulation operations, specifying translation rules er model several major types databases (including relational database). also popularized model introduced academic literature. er model adopted meta-model ansi standard information resource directory system (irds), er approach ranked top methodology database design one top methodologies systems development several surveys fortune 500 companies. === computer-aided software engineering === chen's work cornerstone software engineering, particular computer-aided software engineering (case). late 1980s early 1990s, ibm's application development cycle (ad/cycle) framework db2 repository (rm/mvs) based er model. vendors’ repository systems digital's cdd+ also based er model. chen significant impact case industry research lecturing around world structured system development methodologies. er model influenced major case tools, including computer associates’ erwin, oracle corporation’s designer/2000, sybase’s powerdesigner (and even general drawing tool like microsoft visio), well idef1x standard. er model also basis microsoft's ado.net entity framework. hypertext concept, makes world wide web extremely popular, similar main concept er model. chen investigated linkage invited expert several xml working groups world wide web consortium (w3c). er model also serves foundation recent work object-oriented analysis design methodologies semantic web. uml modeling language roots er model. === computer performance modeling === early career, active r&d activities computer system performance. program chair acm sigmetrics conference. developed computer performance model major computer vendor. innovative research results adopted commercial computer performance tuning capacity === memory storage hierarchy, storage technology, cd-rom, firmware, micro-programming === ph.d. thesis harvard one first studies cost-performance optimization models multi-level memory/storage hierarchies. also one early micro-programmers developing firmware file control unit ibm mainframe computer. article "cd-rom" ieee proceedings journal 1980s one first articles explaining cd-rom worked cd-roms became popular. co-author storage technology article early versions computer encyclopedia book published mcgraw-hill. === cyber security terrorist detection === recent years, led multidisciplinary research team developing new efficient effective techniques identifying terrorists malicious cyber transactions. cmu, active r&d activities cert coordination center software engineering institute (sei). === big data, web services, blockchain internet things (iot) === active research lecturing big data emerging technologies. keynote speaker keynote panelist big data ieee conferences. 2014 program chair, 2015–16 conference chair, 2017 honorary chair ieee bigdata congresses. chair 2018 ieee icws conference chair blockchain panel. general chair 2019 ieee service congress, milan, italy. received 2002 acm - aaai allen newell award, one top awards jointly sponsored computer ai professional societies. == publications == peter p. chen published many books, papers, articles. books (a selection) 2007. active conceptual modeling learning: next generation learning-base system development. leah y. wong (eds.). springer. 1999. advances conceptual modeling: er'99 workshops evolution change data management, reverse engineering information systems, world ... (lecture notes computer science). david w. embley, jacques kouloumdjian, stephen w. liddle john f. roddick (eds.) springer verlag. 1999. conceptual modeling: current issues future directions (lecture notes computer science) jacky akoka, hannu kangassalo, bernhard thalheim. 1985. data & knowledge engineering, volume 1, number 1, 1985. 1981. entity–relationship approach information modeling analysis. 1980. entity–relationship approach systems analysis design. north-holland. articles (a selection) 1976 (march). chen, peter pin-shan (1976). "the entity–relationship model – toward unified view data". acm transactions database systems. 1 (1): 9–36. citeseerx 10.1.1.523.6679. doi:10.1145/320434.320440. s2cid 52801746. issn 0362-5915. 2002. Name: Leonardo Chiariglione
Content: leonardo chiariglione (ipa: [kjariʎˈʎoːne]) (born 30 january 1943 (age 81) almese, turin province, piedmont, italy) italian engineer led development international technical standards digital media. particular, chairman moving picture experts group (mpeg) 1988 2020, co-founded together hiroshi yasuda ntt. == biography == receiving classical high school education liceo salesiano valsalice turin, earned master's degree electronic engineering polytechnic university turin 1967, obtained ph.d. degree university tokyo 1973, also learned speak japanese. chiariglione speaks five languages, including english french. march 1971 july 2003, cselt, corporate research center telecom italia group. final position vice president, multimedia, telecom italia lab, new name given cselt 2001. initiative best known started 1988, originated iso/iec standardization activity known mpeg (or moving picture experts group) (originally iso tc 97/sc 2/wg 8, later iso/iec jtc 1 sc 29/wg 11), convenor (chairman) start june 2020. group, membership 300 experts, representing 20 countries various industries stake digital audio video, produced mpeg-1 mpeg-2 standards facilitated emergence digital audio-visual media. led number european collaborative projects: ivico – race project investigating cost-effective integrated video codecs comis – esprit project supporting development mpeg-1 standard eu 625 vadis – eureka project aiming developing european hardware software technology mpeg-2 standard also initiated efforts define internationally agreed technical specifications, davic (the digital audio-visual council) 1994 fipa (the foundation intelligent physical agents) 1996. 1999, became executive director sdmi (the secure digital music initiative), forum comprising hundreds companies goal develop specifications open standard secure digital music delivery technology. stepped post 2001, expressed frustration conflicts members group, failed produce effective anti-piracy specifications. currently ceo cedeo.net. == awards honors == chiariglione received ibc john tucker award (1999), ieee masaru ibuka consumer electronics award (1999), kilby international award (1998), iet faraday medal (2012). appointed distinguished invited professor information communication university, daejeon, korea, 2004. chiariglione given honorary membership society motion picture television engineers (smpte) october 2014. chiariglione also awarded charles f. jenkins lifetime achievement award (a primetime engineering emmy award) recognition 30 years work co-founder chairman mpeg leading setting worldwide standards digital video compression transmission. blog post, thanking recognition award also highlighted big issues said needed addressed future. == references == == reading == rosenblatt, bill (3 september 2003). "mpeg founder dr. leonardo chiariglione launches digital media project". drm watch. "chiariglione birth mpeg". ieee spectrum. 34 (9). september 1997. "an interview leonardo chiariglione". ieee spectrum. 37 (1). january 2000. == external links == official website moving picture experts group cedeo homepage

Name: Alonzo Church
Content: alonzo church (june 14, 1903 – august 11, 1995) american mathematician, computer scientist, logician, philosopher made major contributions mathematical logic foundations theoretical computer science. best known lambda calculus, church–turing thesis, proving unsolvability entscheidungsproblem ("decision problem"), frege–church ontology, church–rosser theorem. alongside doctoral student alan turing, church considered one founders computer science. == life == alonzo church born june 14, 1903, washington, d.c., father, samuel robbins church, justice peace judge municipal court district columbia. grandson alonzo webster church (1829–1909), united states senate librarian 1881 1901, great-grandson alonzo church, professor mathematics astronomy 6th president university georgia. young boy, church partially blinded air gun accident. family later moved virginia father lost position university failing eyesight. help uncle, also named alonzo church, son attended private ridgefield school boys ridgefield, connecticut. graduating ridgefield 1920, church attended princeton university, exceptional student. published first paper lorentz transformations 1924 graduated year degree mathematics. stayed princeton graduate work, earning ph.d. mathematics three years oswald veblen. married mary julia kuczinski 1925. couple three children: alonzo jr. (1929), mary ann (1933), mildred (1938). receiving ph.d., taught briefly instructor university chicago. received two-year national research fellowship enabled attend harvard university 1927–1928, university göttingen university amsterdam following year. taught philosophy mathematics princeton nearly four decades, 1929 1967. held flint professorship philosophy mathematics university california, los angeles, 1967–1990. plenary speaker icm 1962 stockholm. received honorary doctor science degrees case western reserve university 1969, princeton university 1985, university buffalo, state university new york 1990 connection international symposium honor organized john corcoran. elected corresponding fellow british academy (fba) 1966, american academy arts sciences 1967, national academy sciences 1978. deeply religious person, church lifelong member presbyterian church. died august 11, 1995, age 92. buried princeton cemetery. == mathematical work == church known following significant accomplishments: proof entscheidungsproblem, asks decision procedure determine truth arbitrary propositions first-order mathematical theory, undecidable. known church's theorem. invention lambda calculus. use lambda calculus prove peano arithmetic undecidable. articulation come known church–turing thesis. founding editor journal symbolic logic, editing reviews section 43 years 1936 1979. authorship prominent textbook field mathematical logic, introduction mathematical logic. church–rosser theorem lambda calculus emerged 1936 paper showing unsolvability entscheidungsproblem. result preceded alan turing's work halting problem, also demonstrated existence problem unsolvable mechanical means. upon hearing church's work, turing enrolled princeton later year church ph.d. church turing showed lambda calculus turing machine used turing's halting problem equivalent capabilities, subsequently demonstrated variety alternative "mechanical processes computation." resulted church–turing thesis. efforts automatically generating controller implementation specifications originates ideas. lambda calculus influenced design lisp functional programming languages general. church encoding named honor. honor alonzo church award outstanding contributions logic computation established 2015 association computing machinery special interest group logic computation (acm siglog), european association theoretical computer science (eatcs), european association computer science logic (eacsl), kurt gödel society (kgs). award outstanding contribution field published within past 25 years must yet received recognition via another major award, turing award, paris kanellakis award, gödel prize. == philosophical work == church’s elaboration methodology involving logistic method, philosophical criticisms nominalism defense realism, argumentation leading conclusions theory meaning, detailed construction fregean russellian intensional logics, sufficient place high among Name: Alberto Ciaramella
Content: alberto ciaramella (born 1947) italian computer engineer scientist. notable extensive pioneering contributions field speech technologies applied natural language processing, cselt loquendo, amount 40 papers four patents. == biography == ciaramella obtained laurea electronic engineering post-laurea 1969 la sapienza university rome prof. antonio ruberti supervisor thesis. then, joined cselt research engineer. 1975 patented cselt one first architecture-independent bootstrap devices allowed gruppi speciali (the first electronic italian telephone switch advanced project italian seventies) start pushing single button rom memory case failure. 80s ciaramella took part european projects (esprit p26, sundial) pioneering field speech recognition dialogue systems many european languages, italian, proposed method evaluate quality dialogue systems comparing meanings. 1983 co-authored one first international patents speaker recognition, new research field time, applied commercially speech recognition software licensed cselt. 1990 co-authored one first international patents real-time speech recognition system integrated microprocessor suitable used telecommunication company: microprocessor named ripac (riconoscitore di parlato connesso - stated patent description itself). extensive research conducted hidden markov model aimed speech recognition tasks, using small big dictionaries applied many cases - e.g. recognition children's voice, browser navigation voice. contributions include test proposals international communication standards, voicexml. 2001 cselt's voice technology group became loquendo alberto ciaramella became competitive intelligence supervisor company. 2005 ciaramella founded intellisemantic incubator politecnico di torino, innovative company works field competitive business intelligence. also within present company, continues research field applied language technologies. 2010 co-authored paper view application emerging "semantic" technologies patent analysis, became popular field patent informatics, took part topas european project focused patent summarization. == bibliography == billi, r., canavesio, f., ciaramella, a., & nebbia, l. Name: Edmund M. Clarke
Content: edmund melson clarke, jr. (july 27, 1945 – december 22, 2020) american computer scientist academic noted developing model checking, method formally verifying hardware software designs. fore systems professor computer science carnegie mellon university. clarke, along e. allen emerson joseph sifakis, received 2007 acm turing award. == biography == born newport news, virginia, clarke received b.a. degree mathematics university virginia, charlottesville, 1967, m.a. degree mathematics duke university, durham nc, 1968, ph.d. degree computer science cornell university, ithaca ny 1976. receiving ph.d., taught department computer science duke university, two years. 1978, moved harvard university, cambridge, assistant professor computer science division applied sciences. left harvard 1982 join faculty computer science department carnegie mellon university, pittsburgh, pa. appointed full professor 1989. 1995, became first recipient fore systems professorship, endowed chair carnegie mellon school computer science. became university professor 2008 became emeritus professor 2015. died covid-19 december 2020, age 75, covid-19 pandemic pennsylvania. == work == clarke's interests included software hardware verification automatic theorem proving. ph.d. thesis proved certain programming language control structures good hoare-style proof systems. 1981 ph.d. student e. allen emerson first proposed use model checking verification technique finite-state concurrent systems. research group pioneered use model checking hardware verification. symbolic model checking using binary decision diagrams also developed group. important technique subject kenneth mcmillan's ph.d. thesis, received acm doctoral dissertation award. addition, research group developed first parallel resolution theorem prover (parthenon) first theorem prover based symbolic computation system (analytica). 2009, led creation computational modeling analysis complex systems (cmacs) center, funded national science foundation. center team researchers, spanning multiple universities, applying abstract interpretation model checking biological embedded systems. == professional recognition == clarke fellow acm ieee. received technical excellence award semiconductor research corporation 1995 allen newell award excellence research carnegie mellon computer science department 1999. co-winner along randal bryant, e. allen emerson, kenneth mcmillan acm paris kanellakis award 1999 development symbolic model checking. 2004 received ieee computer society harry h. goode memorial award significant pioneering contributions formal verification hardware software systems, profound impact contributions electronics industry. elected national academy engineering 2005 contributions formal verification hardware software correctness. elected american academy arts sciences 2011. received herbrand award 2008 "recognition role invention model checking sustained leadership area two decades." 2012, received honorary doctorate tu wien outstanding contributions field informatics. received 2014 bower award prize achievement science franklin institute "his leading role conception development techniques automatically verifying correctness broad array computer systems, including found transportation, communications, medicine." member sigma xi phi beta kappa. == see also == list pioneers computer science ==
